208,"<summary>

• The invention relates to esophageal electrodes, specifically an esophageal-stomach displacement electrode that can be inserted into the esophagus and stomach to stimulate the ventricle of the heart.

column2: • The electrode is designed to be positioned close to the heart to reduce the amount of electrical energy required for pacing or defibrillation.
• The electrode is part of a non-invasive procedure that does not require a sterile atmosphere or a physician's presence.
• The invention builds upon previous patents and applications that disclose methods and apparatus for esophageal electrodes.

column1: • The esophageal-stomach displacement electrode consists of a semi-rigid plastic tube with an electrode on the distal end.

column2: • The tube is designed to be inserted into the esophagus and stomach, and has a mechanism that allows the distal end to bend back on itself by approximately 135 degrees.
• The bent section of the tube prohibits further withdrawal of the electrode, ensuring it remains in place.
• The electrode is spherical in shape and has a stem that fits within the distal end of the tube.

column1: • The control mechanism for the electrode includes a sleeve, slide, and cords that operate the displacement mechanism.

column2: • The cords are connected to the proximal and distal ends of a rigid pin that spans the hinge of the tube.
• The pin is designed to move freely in the tube and apply a bending force to the interior of the tube.
• The control mechanism allows the operator to move the slide to deflect the distal portion of the tube and place the electrode in proximity to the upper stomach wall.

column1: • The electrode can be used in various medical procedures, including pacing and defibrillation.

column2: • The invention provides a convenient means of placing the electrode close to the heart or other organs without invasive surgery.
• The electrode can be used in conjunction with an external electrode on the chest to impose pacing pulses.
• The invention reduces the amount of electrical energy required for pacing or defibrillation, making it more efficient and effective.",0

column1: 210,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a device and method for treating wounds and promoting tissue growth.

column2: * The device uses a combination of fluid supply and suction to promote healing and tissue regeneration.

column1: * The device consists of a dressing pad with open pores, a supply port, and a drainage port.

column2: * The dressing pad is placed on the wound and covered with a pliable, adhesive film.
* The supply port and drainage port are connected to tubes that allow for the supply of treatment fluid and the removal of waste products.

column1: * The device uses a pump to create a negative pressure at the drainage port, which helps to promote healing and tissue growth.

column2: * The pump can be adjusted to create a range of negative pressures, from -20 mmHg to -200 mmHg.
* The device can be used in a continuous or intermittent mode.

column1: * The device can be used to supply treatment fluids, such as antibiotics, growth factors, and nutrients, to the wound.

column2: * The device can also be used to remove debris and waste products from the wound.
* The device can be used in conjunction with a scaffold to promote tissue regeneration.

column1: * The device includes a sensor to detect bleeding from the wound during treatment.

column2: * The sensor uses a weighing technique to detect changes in the weight of the fluid in the canister.
* The device can alert the user to bleeding through an alarm or display.

column1: * The device can be used in a variety of settings, including hospitals, clinics, and home care.

column2: * The device is easy to use and can be operated by a single person.
* The device is portable and can be used in a variety of locations.

column1: * The device has several advantages over existing wound treatment devices.

column2: * The device promotes healing and tissue growth through the use of negative pressure and the supply of treatment fluids.
* The device is easy to use and can be used in a variety of settings.

column1: * The device has been tested and has shown promising results in promoting wound healing and tissue growth.

column2: * The device has been used to treat a variety of wounds, including chronic wounds and wounds that cannot be sutured.
* The device has been shown to be safe and effective in promoting wound healing and tissue growth.",0

column1: 213,"<summary>

• The invention relates to a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod, particularly Calanus finmarchicus, which is rich in wax esters, stearidonic acid (SDA), eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA).

column2: • The oil composition has a unique fatty acid profile and is characterized by a high content of SDA, EPA, and DHA, as well as a high proportion of wax esters.

column1: • The oil composition has been shown to have beneficial effects on cardiovascular health, including the prevention and treatment of atherosclerosis, hypercholesterolaemia, and elevated blood cholesterol levels.

column2: • The composition has been found to inhibit the formation of atherosclerotic plaques and to reduce total blood cholesterol levels.

column1: • The oil composition can be used as a medicament, dietary supplement, or functional food ingredient, and can be administered orally in a daily dosage of 4-100 mg/kg body weight.

column2: • The composition can be formulated into various forms, including capsules, tablets, emulsions, and tonics, and may include pharmaceutically acceptable additives.

column1: • The invention also provides a method for the prophylaxis or treatment of cardiovascular disease, particularly atherosclerosis, hypercholesterolaemia, and elevated blood cholesterol levels, using the biological oil composition.

column2: • The method involves orally administering the composition to an individual in need of such treatment, and may be used in combination with other therapeutic agents.

column1: • The biological effects of the copepod oil were studied in mice deficient in apolipoprotein E (ApoE), and the results showed that the oil composition inhibited the formation of atherosclerotic plaques and reduced total blood cholesterol levels.

column2: • The study demonstrated the potential of the copepod oil as a therapeutic agent for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease.",1

column1: 214,"Here is the summary of the text in 7 bullet points with 2 levels of indentation:
<summary>
* The invention relates to pharmacological compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes in microparticulate form and at least one active substance.

column2: * The active substance can be embedded in the matrix of the polyelectrolyte complex, be a partner in the polyelectrolyte complex, or be bound to a partner of the polyelectrolyte complex.
* The active substances include pharmacological active substances, contrast agents, and vaccines.

column1: * The polyelectrolyte complexes are formed from biocompatible, biodegradable polyacids and polybases, which can be naturally occurring or composed of natural subunits.

column2: * The polyacids and polybases can be hydrophobically substituted to improve their properties.
* Examples of polyacids and polybases include xylan polysulfate, polyaspartic acid, and poly-L-lysine.

column1: * The microparticles can be prepared in various sizes, from a few nm to a few hundred μm, depending on the requirements.

column2: * The particle size can be controlled by the stirring speed, drop rate, nozzle diameter, and pH.
* The microparticles can be in the form of emulsions.

column1: * The incorporation of an active substance in the polyelectrolyte complex particles can be carried out in four ways: entrapment, absorption, precipitation, and chemical binding.

column2: * The release of the active substance can be controlled by the composition of the complex and the particle size.
* The release profiles can be adjusted to meet specific requirements.

column1: * The polyelectrolyte complex microparticles are suitable for various pharmaceutical applications, including cancer therapy, vaccination, and wound treatment.

column2: * They can also be used as air-containing echogenic contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis.
* The particles can be administered orally, intravenously, or through injection.

column1: * The invention also relates to a process for preparing pharmaceutical compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes and active substances.

column2: * The process involves mixing solutions of an acidic and a basic substance, where at least one of the partners is an active substance or contains the latter in chemically bound form.
* The resulting polyelectrolyte complex is precipitated in microparticulate form or converted into a microparticulate form.

column1: * The examples provided in the text demonstrate the preparation and characterization",0

column2: * The device can be clipped to a golf bag or the golfer's apparel when not in use.

column1: 216,"<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a person support apparatus, such as a bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of a patient support frame.

column2: * The apparatus includes a deck support frame with two sides extending between a head end and a foot end.
* The deck support frame is supported by leg assemblies pivotally coupled to the frame and floor engaging means.
* The leg assemblies are moved by actuators to raise or lower the deck support frame.

column1: * The leg assemblies include guide elements that run along inner surfaces of channel elements on the deck support frame.

column2: * The channel elements are inverted U-shaped and have a downward-facing opening.
* The guide elements are rollers that roll along the inner surfaces of the channel elements.
* The rollers are supported on axles that run through the leg assemblies.

column1: * The apparatus can be moved into Trendelenburg or reverse Trendelenburg positions by raising or lowering one end of the deck support frame.

column2: * The apparatus includes castors with braking mechanisms that can be actuated by a braking lever.
* The braking lever is contacted by the underside of the channel element as the bed is lowered to the lowermost position.
* The braking mechanism can be used to lock or brake the castors.

column1: * The present disclosure provides a robust and stable deck support frame that can accommodate changes in geometry necessary for movement or adjustment between the horizontal, Trendelenburg, and reverse Trendelenburg positions.

column2: * The design reduces the risk of trapping fingers or other body parts.
* The design also reduces the force necessary to lift the patient support frame, especially from the low position.
* The use of rollers reduces frictional forces and makes the mechanism less likely to fail.",0

column1: * The apparatus uses a relative measurement between specular reflection and diffuse reflection

* The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants.

column2: * The invention provides a reliable anchoring of the mesh implant.
* The invention uses a needle for surgical threading of a strap of an implant through a tissue.

column3: * The needle has a trap for trapping the strap to the needle.
* The trap may comprise a niche and a rod for grasping the end of the strap.
* The mechanism for releasing the trap may be manually driven.

column1: * The invention also relates to an anterior implant and a posterior implant.

column3: * The anterior implant has at least two first straps for threading into the arcus tendineous fascia pelvic (ATFP) ligaments.
* The anterior implant has at least two second straps for threading into the sacrospinous (SS) ligaments.
* The anterior implant has a loop between the second straps for anchoring to the cervix.

column1: * The invention also relates to a method for using a needle to thread a strap through a surface.

column3: * The method involves trapping an end of the strap while the needle is at the accessible side of the surface tissue.
* The method involves threading the needle, together with the trapped strap, through the surface, from the accessible side of the surface.
* The method involves releasing the trap, such that the driving of release is from the accessible side.

column1: * The invention also relates to a method for installing an anterior implant.

column3: * The method involves threading at least two first straps of the implant into the ATFP ligaments.
* The method involves threading at least two second straps of the implant into the SS ligaments.
* The method involves anchoring a loop between the second straps to the cervix.

column1: * The invention also relates to a method for installing a posterior implant.

column3: * The method involves threading at least two straps of the implant into the SS ligaments.
* The method involves anchoring a first loop between the straps, to the cervix.
* The method involves anchoring a second loop at the side opposing the straps, to the perineal body.

column1: * The invention provides a reliable and minimally invasive method for pelvic floor reconstruction using implants.

column3: * The invention reduces the risk of complications and improves patient outcomes.
* The invention provides a more efficient and effective way to perform pelvic floor reconstruction surgery.",0

column1: 220,"<summary>
• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.

column2: • The invention is suitable for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance, particularly during sleep.
• The ventilator delivers air or air enriched with oxygen to the subject via an interface such as a nose mask.

column1: • The invention aims to address three goals: matching the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts, automatically adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum ventilation, and providing immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.

column2: • The invention uses fuzzy logic to determine the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable.
• The phase is determined from the respiratory airflow, which is measured and corrected for leaks.

column1: • The invention discloses several methods for providing ventilatory assistance, including methods ""A"", ""B"", and ""C"".

column2: • Method ""A"" calculates the instantaneous inspired volume and uses it to determine the desired delivery pressure.
• Method ""B"" calculates the desired delivery pressure based on the respiratory airflow and phase.

column1: • The invention also discloses apparatus to give effect to each of the methods, including transducers to measure flow and pressure, a processor to perform calculations, and a flow generator to supply breathable gas.

column2: • The apparatus can include ventilators, ventilatory assist devices, and CPAP devices.
• The invention can be used for subjects with varying respiratory mechanics, insufficient respiratory drive, abnormal chemoreceptor reflexes, hypoventilation syndromes, or Cheyne Stokes breathing.

column1: • The invention uses fuzzy logic to calculate the degree of membership in various fuzzy sets, such as ""large negative"", ""small negative"", ""zero"", ""small positive"", and ""large positive"".

column2: • The fuzzy sets are used to determine the phase and degree of assistance.
• The invention can be implemented using electrical analogs or digital computers.

column1: • The invention has been tested and shown to be effective in providing ventilatory assistance to subjects with various respiratory needs.

column2: • The invention can be used in a variety of settings, including hospitals and homes.
• The invention has the potential to improve the quality of life for subjects with respiratory disorders.",0

column1: 221,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a novel electro-surgical dissection and cauterization instrument for use in laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures.

column2: • The instrument is designed to overcome the limitations of existing instruments, which have a working tip electrode that extends directly from the insulating sleeve, obstructing the surgeon's view of the operation site.

column1: • The instrument includes a rigid arm that extends from the distal end of the insulating sleeve to the working tip electrode, with portions of the arm laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve.

column2: • This design allows for maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site by the surgeon.

column1: • The arm is electrically conductive and is surrounded by a thin layer of insulating material, preventing unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue.

column2: • The working tip electrode is formed at the free end of the arm and is used to make direct contact with the patient at the internal operation site.

column1: • The instrument is designed for use in various surgical procedures, including laparoscopic cholecystectomy, appendectomy, and lysis of adhesions.

column2: • The instrument can be used in both open surgery and endoscopic procedures.

column1: • The invention provides an electrical insulating layer along the entire length of the tool, up to the exposed working tip electrode, eliminating the risk of inadvertent cauterization of tissue with portions of the tool other than the working tip electrode.

column2: • The instrument is designed for easy handling and use by the surgeon.

column1: • The invention includes various embodiments of the working tip electrode, including a hook and flattened spatula, each designed for specific surgical applications.

column2: • The instrument is designed to be single-use and disposable, reducing the risk of cross-contamination and infection.",1

column1: 222,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus that allows exposures with a subject in at least two predetermined exposure positions.

column2: • The apparatus has a magnet, at least one patient receptacle, and at least one support plate, as well as a predetermined number of transmit and/or receive coils.

column1: • In known MRI apparatuses, exposure parameters must be modified for different exposure positions, which requires a readjustment of the apparatus.

column2: • The adjustment serves to optimize the RF chain and the homogeneity of the main magnetic field in the imaging volume.

column1: • The exposure parameters are patient-dependent, and a precise adjustment is necessary for patient safety with respect to RF exposure.

column2: • Known MRI apparatuses recognize automatically whether exposure parameters must be modified and carry out a readjustment if warranted.

column1: • The adjustment process typically requires 10 to 90 seconds per exposure position, which can be a limitation in certain examination procedures.

column2: • This limitation can be overcome by omitting further adjustments, but this leads to a considerable worsening of image quality.

column1: • The object of the present invention is to provide an MRI apparatus that provides high-contrast exposures in a short time, even for larger body segments.

column2: • This is achieved by determining the required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and storing them until the conclusion of the examination.

column1: • The inventive apparatus allows for high-contrast exposures without omitting adjustments, and reduced examination times result from the stored adjustment parameters.

column2: • The apparatus is suitable for various forms of MRI apparatuses, including those with cylindrical or horseshoe magnets.",0

column1: 225,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly for water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts.

column2: * The system is designed to eliminate air bubbles that may accumulate in the cooling system, which can cause local overheating and reduce efficiency.
* The invention provides a simple and effective solution to this problem.

column1: * Prior art solutions have been inadequate, with some systems requiring long, thin pipes that extend from the branch point of the cooling water connections to the exterior of the machine.

column2: * These solutions have been found to require considerable engineering effort and are not practical for many applications.
* The present invention provides a more efficient and effective solution.

column1: * The invention involves the use of a bypass with at least one inlet and one outlet, arranged between the feed duct and the discharge duct of the apparatus.

column2: * The bypass has at least one inlet that opens into the space around the axis of rotation of the apparatus, where air bubbles tend to accumulate.
* This allows for the automatic removal of air bubbles from the system.

column1: * The bypass can be arranged in or on an end face of the feed duct, or as a radially arranged pipe member with at least one inlet in the space around the axis of rotation.

column2: * The bypass can also be designed as a coiled pipe with at least one inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation.
* This allows for flexibility in the design and implementation of the ventilation system.

column1: * The invention provides several advantages, including the rapid and complete removal of air bubbles from the system.

column2: * The system is relatively simple in design and construction, and can be implemented with minimal engineering effort.
* The invention also allows for the achievement of an adequate pressure drop over a short distance with a low resistance to flow.

column1: * The invention is applicable to a wide range of rotating water feeds, including those used in water-cooled generators and turbogenerators.

column2: * The invention can be used in a variety of configurations, including those with coaxial feed and discharge ducts.
* The invention provides a significant improvement over prior art solutions and offers a practical and effective solution to the problem of air bubbles in rotating water feeds.",0

* The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle, which comprises a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft rotatably about its longitudinal axis and a retaining part, which the jacket unit is secured non-displaceably up to a limit value of a force acting onto the jacket unit parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft in the direction toward the front of the motor vehicle.

column2: * If the limit value is exceeded, the jacket unit is displaceable parallel to the longitudinal axis in the direction toward the motor vehicle front, wherein the jacket unit is connected with the retaining part across an energy absorption connection, which comprises at least one bending wire or strip that, upon a displacement of the jacket unit with respect to the retaining part parallel to the longitudinal direction toward the motor vehicle front, is deformed.

* The invention further relates to a method for the production of such a steering column, which is characterized by the steps of providing a jacket unit and a retaining part, connecting the jacket unit with the retaining part across a break-away connection and an energy absorption connection, and prestressing the energy absorption connection in the direction of the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.

227,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to a process for mounting glass panels in curved window bays of motor vehicles and the like.

column2: • The process utilizes flat, uncurved glass panels to form curved windows in vehicles.
• The conventional process of installing curved glass panels has many disadvantages, including distortion of the glass during tempering and contouring, and increased cost.

column1: • The conventional process makes the glass panel less flexible and more brittle, which can cause it to dislodge from the window bay in the event of an accident.

column2: • The conventional process also makes the vehicular body less able to resist crushing if the window breaks during an accident.

column1: • The present invention provides an improved process that overcomes the disadvantages of the conventional process.

column2: • The present invention allows for the use of flat, uncontoured glass panels that are less expensive than pre-contoured glass panels.

column1: • The present invention involves flexing the flat glass panel to conform to the curved window bay, and then applying a weather sealant and adhesive compound to hold the panel in place.

column2: • The fastening means used in the present invention includes a plurality of resilient clips and a reveal molding that presses on the outer surface of the glass panel.

column1: • The reveal molding is provided with a resilient bias, which pushes the glass panel into conforming engagement with the window bay.

column2: • The adhesive compound is applied in situ along the confronting edges of the window panel and allowed to cure until the panel becomes fixed permanently in the window opening.

column1: • The present invention provides a process for economically and inexpensively installing glass windows of a curved nature in vehicle windows and the like.

column2: • The present invention is not limited to the installation of glass in the rear window of an automobile, but can be applied to other vehicle windows and the like.",0

column1: 233,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a grounding product for railroad car center plate assembly bowl liners made of all polymeric material.

column2: • The liner material has similar mechanical properties to the liner disclosed in Chierici and Murphy U.S. Pat. No. 4,075,951.
• The invention exceeds the NFPA standards for static electricity conductivity by an order of magnitude.

column1: • The prior art rail car truck bowl liners have several disadvantages, including the need for lubrication, non-conductivity, and wear and damage problems.

column2: • The Chierici and Murphy patent discloses a bowl liner made of ultra high molecular weight polymer with dry self-lubricating characteristics.
• The Wulff patent discloses a grounding method using conductive shunt clips and metal rivets.

column1: • The present invention provides a liner with all the benefits of the Chierici et al patent and is conductive, eliminating the need for additional grounding apparatus.

column2: • The liner is composed of a base ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) material with a conductive material additive, such as 2.0% carbon black.
• The conductive material is mixed with the UHMW-PE in particulate or powder form and then heated under mold pressure for thermoforming.

column1: • The liner has a high degree of elastic memory for full return to original shape after being stressed, up to its elastic limit.

column2: • The liner is pliable but non-stretchable and is free from distending or stretching characteristics.
• The liner resists any substantial compaction under compressive forces up to its elastic limit.

column1: • The invention provides a bowl liner with a conductive ring and an outer ring composed of structural self-lubricating plastic, preferably UHMW-PE.

column2: • The conductive ring has a concentration of conductive material in a preselected location.
• The flange includes a horizontal portion with an internally conical bevel which fits closely against the car bolster.

column1: • The liner forms two slip surfaces with the center plate assembly to insure the needed swivelling action of the car trucks with respect to the car body.

column2: • The primary slip surface is between the upper surface of the liner and the body bolster center plate's lower surface.
• The liner also forms a secondary contingency slip surface between the lower surface of the liner and the truck bolster floor.",0

• The invention relates to a valve for controlling the dispensing of viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches.

235,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a vehicle rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of an output of a vehicle control.

• The system determines the protocol by monitoring the output of the vehicle control and adjusting a running average parameter based on the assumption that the vehicle will more often be in a particular state than not.
• The system uses a microcomputer with software to determine the protocol, which reduces hardware expenses and utilizes existing resources.
• The system can be used with various types of vehicle controls, such as gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information.
• The system includes a power-up sequence and a main sequence to determine the protocol of the output of the vehicle control.
• The power-up sequence sets an initial protocol based on the output of the vehicle control and adjusts the running average parameter accordingly.
• The main sequence repeatedly adjusts the running average parameter based on the output of the vehicle control and updates the protocol if the running average parameter reaches an extreme value.

• The system can override the protocol determined by the running average parameter with an ignition-cycle average parameter to reduce the likelihood of anomalies affecting the performance of the system.
</summary>",0

* The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, which includes an anti-dive device with a damped telescopic front suspension.

column2: * The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and is designed to prevent the front fork from diving during braking.

column3: * The anti-dive device includes a valve body that opens and closes in response to the brake force, controlling the flow of oil between the lower and upper hydraulic chambers of the front fork.
* The valve body is urged in the valve-open direction by a valve spring and is operated by the pressure of the brake fluid from the front master cylinder.
* The anti-dive device helps to maintain the stability of the motorcycle during braking by preventing the front fork from diving and reducing the likelihood of the front wheel locking up.

column1: * The anti-lock braking system also includes a sensor that detects the angular deceleration of the front wheel and operates the pressure discharge valve to reduce the braking pressure when the wheel is about to lock up.

column3: * The sensor includes a flywheel that rotates at a higher speed than the front wheel and a cam means that converts the overrun rotation of the flywheel into axial displacement.
* The axial displacement of the cam means operates a lever that opens the pressure discharge valve, reducing the braking pressure and preventing the front wheel from locking up.
* The system repeats the process of reducing and increasing the braking pressure at a high speed to efficiently brake the front wheel.",0

column1: 238,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography and fluid handling systems.

column2: • The valve has a rotor and stator with multiple ports and channels for fluid flow.
• The rotor has a diaphragm with a dynamic wipe sealing lip that seals against the stator.
• The valve can be partially separated to allow for sanitizing fluid to flow across the sealing faces.
• The valve has a make-before-break feature to prevent interruption of fluid flow during rotation.

column1: • The valve has a barrier fluid flow path to prevent release of liquid to the environment and accumulation of dried salt deposits.

column2: • The barrier fluid flows circumferentially through gutters and channels in the stator.
• The barrier fluid cleans the inner and outer sides of the port sealing ledges.
• The barrier fluid flow is slower than the process fluid flow to prevent solutes from reentering the process streams.

column1: • The valve has secondary containment means for any liquid escaping under the rotor diaphragm.

column2: • The valve has sumps that connect to a sump drain port.
• The sumps provide a means for containing any liquid that escapes during sanitizing.

column1: 245,"<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.

column2: * The method involves anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of the anodic coating.

column1: * The prior art methods have defects such as poor weatherability and fading of the colored aluminum articles.

column2: * The conventional methods also require a large amount of electrical energy and are unsuitable for continuous treatment.

column1: * The present invention provides an apparatus and method for continuously conducting anodic oxidation and electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.

column2: * The apparatus includes a means for continuously supplying an aluminum strip or wire, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, and a means for passing the aluminum strip or wire through the baths.

column1: * The anodic oxidation bath composition is usually an aqueous solution of 10 to 55% sulfuric acid.

column2: * The thickness of the oxide film formed on the aluminum strip or wire should be thicker than 4 microns.

column1: * The electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid.

column2: * The bath composition and electrolytic conditions can be controlled to obtain various colors.

column1: * The apparatus can produce continuously and with a low cost aluminum strips or wires having colored oxide films or layers thereon superior in weatherability or fade resistance.

column2: * The industrial value of the apparatus is quite high.

column1: * The invention can be modified within the scope of the invention to accommodate different requirements.

column2: * The modifications can include changes in the apparatus and method to achieve specific results.

247,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing a refrigerant gas, with an improvement to reduce frictional wear on components.

column2: * The invention applies a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate facial surfaces and ends.
* The coated swash plate can be made from lower cost alloy materials while maintaining durability and efficiency.
* The coating reduces the need for expensive, high silicon aluminum base materials and electroplating processes.

column1: * Swash plate compressors have been used in automotive air conditioning systems for many years.

column2: * The swash plate rotates about a shaft, and pistons slide within cylinder bores positioned parallel to the shaft.
* The facial and end surfaces of the swash plate contact pivoting shoes within the pistons.
* The rotation of the swash plate reciprocates the pistons.

column1: * Prior art coatings include metal matrix coatings with tin, copper, nickel, zinc, lead, and indium.

column2: * These coatings require a highly polished surface and are susceptible to wear.
* Adding fluororesin to the metal matrix coating improves frictional properties but reduces surface hardness.
* The prior art coatings have several disadvantages, including high cost and complexity.

column1: * The present invention provides a coating that is both friction reducing and highly durable.

column2: * The coating permits the use of lower cost, low silicon aluminum base material for the swash plate.
* The coating does not require electroplating or high finish polishing.
* The coating is applied in a liquid spray and cured in an oven at an elevated temperature.

column1: * The coating comprises a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive.

column2: * The polyfluoro elastomer is selected from a class of materials that form highly cross-linked long chain polymers.
* The lubricious additive provides reduced friction in dry conditions.
* The load bearing additive provides high hardness and durability in dry conditions.

column1: * The coating is applied to the swash plate by means of liquid spray.

column2: * The swash plate is masked, and the coating is sprayed onto the facial and end surfaces.
* The coating is cured in an oven at an elevated temperature to form a highly adherent coating.
* The coating has a thickness of approximately 0.0012 inches (30 μm).

column1: * Experimental results show that the coated swash plate exhibits very smooth facial surfaces and end surface.

column2: * The coating reduces the friction coefficient and increases the seizure loads of the swash",0

column1: 248,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, and methods for preparing them.

* These polymers can be used to form a layer which prevents the reflection of light from lower layers coated on a semiconductor chip when photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources are employed.
* The polymers of the present invention can eliminate the standing wave effect when an ArF beam is used, and reflection/diffraction caused by changes in the thickness of the photoresist layer itself.

* The present invention also relates to an anti-reflective composition containing these polymers, alone or in combination with other light-absorbing compounds, and the anti-reflective coating formed from these compositions, as well as preparation methods therefor.
* The polymers of the present invention are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm by having groups that absorb light strongly at both wavelengths.
* The polymers can be prepared in accordance with reaction equations set forth in the document.

* The anti-reflective coating composition of the present invention is prepared by dissolving a polymer in an organic solvent, and subsequently adding thereto one or more compounds selected from Tables 1a and 1b.

* The polymers and compositions of the present invention have proven to be excellent organic anti-reflective coating materials during the formation of submicro-patterns in photolithographic processes using 248 nm KrF and 193 nm ArF lasers.",0

• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having a specific formula.

column2: • The process involves the use of hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce the formation of unwanted impurities.

column1: • The process is used to prepare pyrazolotriazoles, which are useful as magenta couplers in photographic products.

column2: • The pyrazolotriazoles are prepared from triazolothiadiazines, which can be synthesized through two different routes.

column2: • The acylation reaction is conducted using an anhydride and a catalyst, and the deacylation and desulfurization reaction is conducted using hydrochloric acid and hypophosphorous acid.
• The reaction conditions, such as temperature and pressure, can be varied to optimize the process.

column1: • The invention provides several advantages, including improved product yield, reduced impurities, and ease of removal of hydrogen sulfide gas.

column2: • The process is also economical and adaptable to industrial scale.
• The pyrazolotriazoles prepared through this process can be used in various applications, including photographic products.

column1: • The invention is described in detail through several examples, including the preparation of specific pyrazolotriazoles.

column2: • The examples illustrate the effectiveness of the process in improving product yield and reducing impurities.
• The examples also demonstrate the versatility of the process in preparing different pyrazolotriazoles.

column1: • The invention is not limited to the specific examples described, and can be modified and substituted to prepare other pyrazolotriazoles.

column1: 252,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types.

column2: * The method involves measuring the total quantity of each fiber lot and determining a partial quantity to be removed based on a predetermined proportion.
* The partial quantity is then removed from each fiber lot in a sequence of passes.

* The control device ensures that the partial quantity is removed from each fiber lot within a predetermined period.
* The method and apparatus provide for the formation of a homogeneous mixture of fibers with precise control over the proportions of each fiber type.

column3: * The method eliminates the problem of residual fibers in each bale.

column1: 253,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics.

column2: • The fabrics are formed by laying yarns at an angle to the long axis of the fabric.
• The yarns are held together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding.

column1: • The prior art has limitations in forming parallel courses of yarns, resulting in a diminution of strength and uniformity.

column2: • The prior art also results in a waste of yarn due to the 90° return angle.
• The invention overcomes these limitations by using a rake mechanism to accept and retain the yarns.

column1: • The rake mechanism is synchronized with the conveyors and yarn carrying means to achieve parallelism of the yarns.

column2: • The rake mechanism can be moved a distance equivalent to a full course or a fraction of a full course to control the overlap of successive courses.
• The amount of overlap determines the density of the fabric.

column1: • The invention provides for the formation of bias laid fabrics with all yarns in a given layer parallel to each other.

column2: • The parallelism is achieved without complex machinery.
• The invention also provides for greater density and uniformity.

column1: • The apparatus includes a pair of parallel conveyors, yarn carriers, and a rake system.

column2: • The yarn carriers move back and forth between the conveyors, laying yarns at an angle to the long axis of the fabric.
• The rake system accepts and retains the yarns, ensuring parallelism and controlling the overlap of successive courses.

column1: • The invention can be used to form fabrics with various angles of yarn lay, including 30°, 45°, 60°, and 90°.

column2: • The invention can also be used to form fabrics with different densities and uniformities.
• The invention has applications in the formation of structural parts, such as in airplanes.",0

column1: 254,"<summary>

column2: • The invention aims to provide a stable weft insertion process with reduced air consumption by adjusting the air pressure or ejection time according to the type of weft thread being inserted.

column2: • The main nozzle and piping system can also be designed to eject air at different pressures or timings to suit the selected weft thread.

column1: • The invention provides several benefits, including reduced air consumption, stabilized weft insertion, and the ability to insert different types of weft threads with suitable weft carrying forces.

256,"<summary>

• The present invention relates to rolls for use in nipped roll presses, particularly in the manufacture of paper, and provides a method and apparatus for measuring and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of a covered roll.

• The sensing roll has multiple sets of sensors disposed along its length, each set having sensors at the same cross-directional position but spaced apart circumferentially, allowing for the calculation of an average pressure measurement at each cross-directional position and the creation of a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The sensors can be arranged in a helical pattern around the roll, with each set of sensors separated by a certain angle (e.g. 180°) circumferentially around the roll.

• The invention provides advantages over sensing rolls with a single sensor at each cross-directional position, including the ability to detect and compensate for rotational variability and provide a more accurate nip pressure profile.
• The invention can be used in collaboration with correcting instrumentation to eliminate or compensate for pressure variability at locations across the sensing roll.

• The arrangement of sensors allows for the calculation and display of a rotational variability profile, providing the operator with additional real-time information to obtain a more accurate nip pressure profile.",0

* The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine.

column2: * The device is designed to sew buttonholes of a specific length regardless of the type of material being sewn.
* The device includes a foot pad and a travelling assembly that moves with the work being fed during sewing.
* The travelling assembly includes a slidable member that can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn.

column1: * The device includes an adjustable stop that engages a tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole.

column2: * The stop can be adjusted to precisely define the closure point of the buttonhole.
* This prevents the formation of open buttonholes or ones with overlapping stitches.
* The device can be used with different types of materials by adjusting the stop to compensate for varying amounts of slippage.

column1: * The device is attached to a presser bar of a sewing machine and includes a tripping lever that controls the sewing of a buttonhole.

column2: * The tripping lever is actuated by a tab on the travelling assembly.
* The tab is positioned by a button placed between two ""V"" notches on the device.
* The device can be adjusted to sew buttonholes of different lengths by adjusting the position of the tab.

column1: * The device includes two springs that define an initial position for the travelling assembly relative to the foot pad.

column2: * The springs are oppositely acting and include a flat spring and a helical spring.
* The springs allow the travelling assembly to move with the work being fed during sewing.
* The springs also help to maintain the position of the tab and the adjustable stop.

column1: * The device can be used to sew buttonholes in different materials by adjusting the adjustable stop.

column2: * The stop is adjusted by turning a screw that engages the tripping lever.
* The screw is turned until a perfect buttonhole is obtained in a sample material.
* The device can then be used to sew buttonholes in a garment made of the same material.

column1: * The invention provides a buttonhole controlling device that can be used with different types of materials.

column2: * The device is adjustable to compensate for varying amounts of slippage in different materials.
* The device includes a travelling assembly that moves with the work being fed during sewing.
* The device can be used to sew buttonholes of different lengths by adjusting the position of a tab.

column1: * The device is an improvement over prior art devices that do not compensate for slippage in",0
259,"<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid.

column2: * The apparatus includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The conveyor is an endless sieve belt that transports the textile web along a predetermined path.

column1: * The liquid applicator applies a washing or rinsing liquid to the web at a first station.

column2: * The suction device removes the liquid from the web by suction at a second station downstream of the first station.
* The dwell stretch is disposed between the applicator and the suction device.

column1: * The dwell stretch conducts the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.

column2: * This allows the liquid to act on the substances to be removed from the web for a longer time.
* The tension in the textile web is maintained at a small level.

column1: * The apparatus is particularly suitable for treating knitted fabrics and printed materials.

column2: * It allows for effective washing without soiling a white background.
* It is also suitable for ""soilage washing"" and can be followed by a fastness treatment.

column1: * The dwell stretch can be formed by an air pass or a freely rotatable drum.

column2: * The air pass includes a plurality of freely rotatable rollers that guide the web in vertically extending loops.
* The drum is disposed above the upper section of the sieve belt and guides the web in a meander path.

column1: * The suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt.

column2: * It causes the textile web to adhere to the belt and be entrained thereby.
* This entrainment is sufficient to guide the web over several rollers without appreciable longitudinal tensile stresses.

column1: * The apparatus can have a compact construction.

column2: * The textile web is guided back from the dwell loop to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where the web leaves the belt.
* This allows for a compact design and efficient use of space.

column1: * The invention provides a surprising improvement of the washing effect.

column2: * It allows for the removal of considerable amounts of soilage at relatively little expense.
* It is a significant improvement over prior art methods and apparatuses.",0

column1: 260,"<summary>
• Air Flow System

column2: • The air flow system is designed to induce ambient air into the access opening when the door is opened.
• The system includes a header chamber, air hoses, and electrically energized one-way valves.
• The system prevents solvent vapors from escaping when the door is opened.
• The system also prevents air from circulating through the tubs during the spin cycle to minimize streaks and swales.

column1: • Solvent Flow System

column2: • The solvent flow system includes a pump, filters, and valves that control the flow of solvent through the tubs.
• The system recirculates the solvent through the filters and back to the storage tank.
• The system includes a backwash feature to filter the solvent in the reverse direction.
• The system is designed to minimize the loss of solvent vapors.

column1: • Dry Cleaning Cycle

column2: • The dry cleaning cycle includes fill, wash, drain, spin, and dry portions.
• During the fill portion, solvent is pumped into the tubs.
• During the wash portion, the solvent is circulated through the filters and back to the tubs.
• During the drain portion, the solvent is drained from the tubs.

column1: • Solvent Vapor Handling

column2: • The solvent vapor handling system includes a lint box, expandable bag, and condenser housing.
• The system captures and condenses solvent vapors generated during the cleaning cycle.
• The system prevents pressure buildup in the machine.
• The system reclaims solvent vapors for reuse.

column1: • Refrigeration System

column2: • The refrigeration system cools the storage tank and condenser housing.
• The system includes a compressor, condenser, and evaporator coils.
• The system is controlled by a thermostat and timer.
• The system is designed to minimize the vaporization of solvent.

column1: • Controls

column2: • The controls include a timer mechanism, door switch, and control box switch.
• The controls regulate the cleaning cycle and prevent unauthorized access.
• The controls include a ""cartridge dry"" feature for drying filter cartridges.
• The controls are designed to be accessible only to authorized personnel.

column1: • Cartridge Dry Feature

column2: • The ""cartridge dry"" feature allows for the drying of filter cartridges.
• The feature is activated by a switch on the control panel.
• The feature prevents the timer and main motor from operating.
• The feature allows for the recovery of residual solvent from the cartridges.

• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments, particularly using non-eductive drawing.

column2: • The system uses a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments.

column1: • The quench fluid, usually air, is used for both quenching and drawing the filaments, eliminating the need for two separate air sources.

column2: • The drawing chamber is relatively small, allowing for higher quench pressures and velocities without structural deflection problems.

column1: • The system is simpler and more flexible than eductive and non-eductive systems, with fewer hygiene issues and easier cleaning.

column2: • The slot gap opening can be adjusted to control the drawing tension and filament denier.

column1: • The invention can be used to spin a wide variety of polymers, including polyamides, polyesters, polyolefins, and more.

column2: • The system can produce fine continuous filaments with deniers under 5, and production rates over 200 kg per hour per meter of beam width.

column1: • The invention is useful for producing nonwoven webs for various applications, including sanitary products, garments, surgical drapes, and durable goods.

column2: • The method and apparatus can also be used to produce fine continuous filaments for other uses, such as pillow and cushion stuffing.

column1: • The invention has several advantages over prior art systems, including improved web uniformity, isotropicity, and energy efficiency.

column2: • The system is more capital-efficient and requires less maintenance than conventional systems.",0

column1: 262,"<summary>
• Sewing Machine Overview

column2: • The sewing machine 1 includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head.
• The bed is the base portion of the sewing machine.
• The pillar extends upward from the right end of the bed.
• The arm extends to the left from the upper end of the pillar.

column1: • Ultrasonic Pen Overview

column2: • The ultrasonic pen 91 includes a pen body and a pen tip.
• The pen tip is sharp and can be inserted into the pen body.
• The ultrasonic pen 91 includes a switch, a signal output circuit, and an ultrasonic transmitter.
• The switch is turned on and off based on the position of the pen tip.

column1: • Receiver Overview

column2: • The receiver 94 has a rectangular parallelepiped shape.
• An opening is provided in the center of the front face of the receiver 94.
• A wall around the opening is a tapered surface.
• The receiver 94 includes a substrate, a microphone, and a connector.

column1: • Electrical Configuration

column2: • The control portion 60 of the sewing machine 1 includes a CPU, ROM, RAM, EEPROM, and input/output interface.
• The ROM 62 stores programs and data used by the CPU 61.
• The EEPROM 64 stores data of various sewing patterns.
• The input/output interface 65 is connected to the operation switches, touch panel, and drive circuits.

column1: • Position Identification

column2: • The sewing machine 1 identifies a specified position as coordinate information (X, Y, Z).
• The coordinate origin is defined as the center point of the needle hole.
• The Z coordinate of the top surface of the needle plate 34 is 0.
• The coordinates B and C indicate the positions of the receivers 94 and 95.

column1: • Distance Calculation

column2: • The distances EB and EC are calculated based on the Pythagorean theorem.
• The distances EB and EC are expressed by Formulas (1) and (2).
• The propagation times Tb and Tc are identified by calculating the difference between the transmission timing T1 and the detection timing T2.
• The values Xe and Ye are calculated by solving the simultaneous equations represented by Formulas (5) and (6).

column1: • Conditions for Receiver Placement

column2: • The receivers 94 and 95 should be placed to avoid objects entering between the ultrasonic pen 91 and the receivers.

column1: 263,"<summary>
• The invention relates to fabrics and textiles, particularly cellulosic fabric or textile materials.

column2: • It provides preparations for application onto a textile or fabric material to enhance utility.
• The preparations comprise a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder, and a binding agent.
• The functional additive is carried by the wool particles, which have a macrofibril size or below.
• The invention also provides methods of application of functional utility enhancing preparations onto a cellulosic material.

column1: • The wool particles or wool powder have a size of 200 nm or below and may have a helix or helical structure capable of carrying functional additives.

column2: • The functional additives may include anti-UV agents, anti-bacterial agents, or other comparable agents.
• The binding agent may be acrylic copolymer based and aqueous dispersed.
• The cellulosic fabric material may comprise cotton or linen.

column1: • The invention also provides a preparation comprising powdered bamboo fibre as a functional additive.

column2: • The powdered bamboo fibre is ultrafine having a particle size of less than 1 μm.
• The preparation may be bonded to or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric by printing, padding or foam application.
• The method may comprise adding a wetting agent and bamboo powder into water to form a suspension.

column1: • The invention provides a method of preparing a preparation comprising wool as a functional additive carrier.

column2: • The method involves pulverizing wool fibre into ultrafine powder and forming an ultrafine wool suspension.
• The ultrafine wool suspension is then mixed with functional additives and a binding agent.
• The mixture is then applied onto a cellulosic fabric material.

column1: • The invention provides a method of preparing a preparation comprising bamboo fibre as a functional additive.

column2: • The method involves pulverizing bamboo fibre into ultrafine powder and forming an ultrafine bamboo suspension.
• The ultrafine bamboo suspension is then mixed with functional additives and a binding agent.
• The mixture is then applied onto a cellulosic fabric material.

264,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine for use in stitching individual selected patterns into a large fabric such as a bedspread or quilt.

column2: • The machine comprises a large metal frame on which the fabric is stretched, a sewing machine head mounted on a cross beam, and a process controller with a computer aided design program.

• The process controller controls the movement of the quilting table in the X-direction, Y-direction, and combination X-Y direction, and sends voltage commands to the sewing machine process controller to perform stitching functions or auxiliary functions.

column1: • The quilting machine can accommodate computerized pattern quilting of a predetermined computer generated pattern and also accommodate specialized hand selected patterns, or any combination thereof, in the same unit.

column2: • The machine can increase the rate of production of hand guided patterns sewn into large fabrics such as bedspreads or quilts.
• The system eliminates the necessity of using a digitizer/cursor board to individually record numerous plotted points of the pattern drawing and thereafter burn them into an E-Prom.
• The system provides a method of repetitively sewing a pattern into a fabric having a large surface.

column1: • The invention provides an apparatus by which an operator can remain at a remote location from a large frame quilting machine and cause a precise pattern to be sewn into the large bedspread, comforter, quilt, or other fabric.

• The apparatus includes a second structure supporting the fabric in a position relative to the sewing needle so that thread may be sewn into the fabric.
• The second structure is capable of horizontal movement in the X-direction, the Y-direction, or any combination X-Y direction relative to the sewing needle.

* The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.

column2: * The fabric is formed from a first precursor web and a second precursor web with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim in between.
* The precursor webs are subjected to hydroentanglement on a moveable imaging surface with a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The image transfer device imparts a three-dimensional image to the fabric, which is durable to abrasion and distortion due to elongation.

266,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric.

column2: * The device ensures continuous operation, allows for sewing of relatively stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances.

column1: * The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted from the feed path after being contacted by the strip.

column2: * The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring and can be moved into a position to actuate a signal transmitter independently of the strip.

column1: * The stop is displaced by a setting means in the form of an air cylinder and is substantially perpendicular to the feed motion of the workpiece.

column2: * The limits of the setting motion of the stop can be adjusted by displaceable stops.

column1: * The device includes a guide apparatus for guiding the strip of material into the stitch forming area.

column2: * The guide apparatus is mounted for pivoting about a stud and is secured against axial displacement by a locking washer.

column1: * The device includes a control setup that includes a proximity switch and a sequence control for starting the retraction of the stop, the lowering of the presser foot, and the starting of the sewing machine.

column2: * The control setup is arranged to release the switching processes necessary for starting the sewing operation by a single feed motion of the strip.

column1: * The device is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.

column2: * It provides a sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece that is reliable and efficient.",0

column1: 267,"<summary>

* The invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tank top, lower end portion of baseball stockings, a neck rope portion of an apron, or the like.

column2: * The method aims to solve the problems of increased thickness, impaired productivity, and lowered product value associated with traditional sewing methods.

column1: * The invention provides a connective knitting method of two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds.

column2: * The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces, overlaying symmetrical loops of the final course of both knit pieces, and binding off the overlaid symmetrical loops gradually.

column1: * The knitting machine used in the invention is a flat knitting machine with multiple knitting needles disposed on needle beds laid out in a V-form.

column2: * The rear needle bed is formed movably in the lateral direction.

column1: * The method involves knitting two pieces of tape-shaped knit fabric with a boundary between them on one of the needle beds.

column2: * The loops of the final course of one of the knit fabrics are transferred to the needles of the other needle bed, and the needle bed is moved to overlay the loops.

column1: * The overlaid loops are bound off, and the process is repeated to join the end parts of both knit fabrics.

column2: * The final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch.

column1: * The invention can be realized using a flat knitting machine with multiple pairs of needle beds, and the front needle bed can be movable instead of the rear needle bed.

column2: * The matrix texture of the belt-shaped knit fabric can be plain knitting, rib knitting, tubular knitting, or any other.

column1: * The invention can be applied to various parts linking tape- or rope-shaped portions, such as the neck rope part of a tank top, lower end portion of baseball stockings, or neck rope part of an apron.

column2: * The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.

* The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which provides a new and useful solution for preventing co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing.

column2: * The holding means are arranged on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing, allowing the needle thread loop to expand unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached.
* The invention eliminates the impediment of thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod, allowing the needle thread loop to move unhindered through the thread passage gap.

* The capsule release device gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod, allowing the needle thread loop to slip through unhindered.

270,"<summary>
* The invention relates to methods for producing silicon-based nanowires and materials using four-component and five-component liquid silane inks.

column2: * The four-component ink consists of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, which are combined and electrospun to form fibers that can be transformed into silicon-containing materials.

column3: * The liquid silane can be cyclohexasilane or other silanes with the formula Si n H 2n or Si n H 2n+2.
* The polymer can be poly(methyl methacrylate) or a polycarbonate.
* The accelerant can be a polyhydropolysilane.

column1: * The five-component ink adds a solid phase component to the four-component ink, which can be a particulate, photoactive, or reactive compound.

column2: * The solid phase can comprise metal spheres, silicon nanowires, carbon particulates, or other materials.
* The five-component ink can be used to produce silicon-based materials with specific properties.

column1: 271,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each having a brake rotor and an adjustable braking element.

column2: * The braking element is coupled to a tensioning lever that is biased by the departing thread to take up an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.

column1: * The invention aims to provide an arrangement that allows for both global and individual control of thread tension in a spool creel.

column2: * This is achieved through the use of a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different spool holder, and a biasing arrangement that can be activated by fluid pressure.

column1: * The biasing arrangement is connected to the tensioning lever and influences the thread tension by operating in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever.

column2: * The fluid pressure can be centrally set to determine the thread tension for the entire creel.

column1: * The invention also allows for rapid braking action when the warping machine is shut off, by increasing the braking force throughout the entire creel.

column2: * This is achieved through the use of a brake shoe that is applied to a further braking surface under higher fluid pressures.

column1: * The biasing arrangement is preferably formed by a piston/cylinder assembly, which can readily follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever by changing its length.

column2: * This allows for a smooth and precise control of the thread tension.

column1: * The invention also provides for alternative embodiments, including the use of an electromagnetic brake and a magnetic system that generates eddy currents in a braking disc.

column2: * These alternative embodiments offer additional possibilities for controlling thread tension in a spool creel.",1

column1: 272,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.

column2: • The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
• It overcomes the disadvantages of conventional detectors, such as vibration, noise, and interference.

column1: • The detector uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs with light-transmitting base materials and printed light shielding areas.

column2: • The discs are mounted coaxially on a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft.
• The light shielding areas are designed to detect the sewing machine speed, needle UP position, and thread trimmer timing position.
• The discs are rotatable to adjust the angle of detection.

column1: • The detector also includes an optical fiber supporter with linear optical fiber fixing holes and reflecting portions.

column2: • The optical fibers are not flexed when inserted into the fixing holes.
• The reflecting portions are provided opposite the end faces of the light sending and receiving optical fibers.
• The detector provides accurate and stable operation, reduces stress on the optical fibers, and simplifies construction.",0

column1: 276,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can dissipate energy during dynamic events, such as earthquakes, by undergoing plastic deformation.

column2: • The device is designed to limit the loads transmitted to parts of the structure that are difficult to repair or replace.
• The device can be replaced after plastic deformation, allowing for easy maintenance and repair of the structure.

column1: • The load-limiting device can be integrated into existing braced frame structures, and can be used in various types of structures, including buildings, bridges, and heavy lifting equipment.

column2: • The device can be connected to the bracing of the structure using a connection means, such as a high-strength bolt or weld.
• The device can be designed to have different geometries and shapes to accommodate various structural applications.

column1: • The load-limiting device can undergo plastic deformation during a dynamic event, forming plastic hinges that allow it to dissipate energy and limit the loads transmitted to the structure.

column2: • The device can be designed to have a specific plastic moment capacity, depending on the geometry of the braced frame system and the plastic moment capacities of the relevant cross-sections.
• The device can be used in conjunction with other energy dissipation systems, such as hydraulic dampers, to provide additional protection against dynamic events.",0

column1: 277,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use in a flophouse or temporary accommodation, with a focus on providing a compact and functional space for individuals.

column2: * The cabinet is composed of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them that can be used for housing electrical devices, shelves, and ventilation.

column1: 278,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of a safety barrier or fence at sites under construction.

column2: • The guard rail support is designed to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights.
• The invention addresses the need for a portable and simple guard rail system that meets safety guidelines and can be assembled and disassembled efficiently.

column1: • The guard rail support consists of a substantially flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, at least one guard rail support bracket, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring.

column2: • The base plate is provided with bores for receiving fastening means to anchor the support to a floor or ground surface.
• The guard rail support bracket and retaining flange are dimensioned to accommodate wooden guard rails and kick boards.

column1: • The guard rail support can be used to construct a safety barrier by locating multiple supports at spaced intervals along the perimeter of a floor under construction.

column2: • The upper and lower wooden guard rails and kick boards are secured within the brackets and flanges of adjacent supports.
• The safety barrier can be easily installed and removed by a single worker.

column1: • The invention provides an advantage over prior art guard rail systems, which are often makeshift and require more than one person to construct.

column2: • The guard rail support of the present invention reduces or eliminates the liability resulting from inadequately re-installed guard rails.
• The all-steel construction of the guard rail support ensures durability and repeated use for many years.

column1: • The guard rail support can be used in various embodiments, including the provision of a temporary guard railing around the perimeter of a roof structure or along the sides of a bridge construction.

column2: • The invention is not limited to use in construction sites, but can be employed in any situation where a temporary guard rail is required.
• The guard rail support can be modified as required to suit different applications.",0

column1: 279,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for stimulating crude oil reservoirs to enhance production using a combination of pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.

column2: * The invention uses a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations to stimulate oil production, which is different from prior art that relies on acoustic vibrations only or a combination of acoustic vibrations and low-frequency AC or DC electrical stimulation.

column1: * The invention includes various embodiments, such as a multi-level tool that allows time sequential and variable inductance discharges with both EH and EM discharge devices, and a single-turn coil EM discharge device that produces a magnetic pulse with no acoustic pulse effect.

column2: * The invention also includes improvements to the basic tool design, such as directional focusing and shaping devices, and electrodes designed to withstand the pulse discharge better and last longer.",1

column1: 280,"<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures.

column2: * The splice includes two wave plates with transverse protrusions that receive and seat transverse wires of the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.

* The wave plates are coupled together using a connective device that extends through perforations in the plates, clamping down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and grid-strip.
* The splice allows for the extension of the soil reinforcing element to a desired length, enabling it to adequately reinforce a vertical facing in MSE structures.

column3: * The splice can be used with various designs of soil reinforcing elements and connective devices.
* The splice can be secured using a nut and bolt or similar attachment methods.

column2: * The disclosure also relates to a composite soil reinforcing element comprising a soil reinforcing element, a grid-strip, and a splice that couples the two.

column3: * The composite soil reinforcing element can be used to reinforce a vertical facing in MSE structures.
* The length of the composite soil reinforcing element can be extended by adding additional grid-strips and splices.",0

column1: 281,"<summary>

* The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production.
* The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, providing the ability to rebuild a blade, replacing a portion of the blade that may be worn.
* The process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along a plow blade maximizes desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid.
* This method is adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities.
* The plow blade design includes a blade, leading edge sections, a point, and a fluid tube, with a chute attached to the rear edge of the blade to receive and guide a utility line.
* The leading edge sections are attached to the blade with stitch welds, defining flow paths for the pressurized fluid.
* The fluid tube is adapted to travel in a void in the leading edge section, transferring pressurized fluid from the top of the plow to the void.
* The fluid is ejected from the blade through gaps between the stitch welds, with the location and length of the stitch welds defining the location and volume of fluid ejection.
* The design allows for varying the length of the fluid tube and the number of leading edge sections to match specific job requirements.",0

283,"<summary>
* The safe construction described in the patent application includes a valuables receiving chamber with a door that fits into a groove system formed by bar members and sidewalls.
* The door is secured in place by a lockbolt that engages a notch in one of the bar members, and safety bolts that prevent lateral movement of the door.
* The safe can be constructed using a liner made of plastic, metal, or other materials, and can be embedded in concrete for added security.
