284,"<summary>
• The invention relates to the monitoring and measuring of fluid pressures in geological formations.

column2: • It provides a more accurate measurement of fluid pressure in the part of the formation at the same depth or elevation as the pressure sensor.
• The invention achieves this by isolating the pressure sensor in the borehole so that it is only exposed to the fluid pressure in the formation adjacent to the sensor.

column1: • The invention uses a cement grout to fill the borehole and a filter to connect the pressure sensor to the formation.

column2: • The filter is cleared of cement grout by pumping a fluid through the system before the grout sets.
• The fluid is then pumped again to displace the grout and create a void or communication path between the formation and the pressure sensor.

column1: • The pressure sensor is connected to a check valve and a fluid injection tube, which allows for the injection of fluid to clear the filter and displace the grout.

column2: • The check valve prevents the fluid from flowing back up the tube and ensures that the pressure sensor is only exposed to the fluid pressure in the formation.
• The fluid injection tube can be connected to a larger tube at the surface, allowing for the removal and relocation of the pressure sensor.

column1: • The invention can be used in a variety of applications, including groundwater monitoring and petroleum exploration.

column2: • It provides a more accurate and reliable measurement of fluid pressure in geological formations.
• The invention can be used in a variety of geological formations, including low-permeability formations.

column1: • The invention can be used in conjunction with other techniques, such as hydrofracture, to enhance the accuracy of the pressure measurement.

column2: • The hydrofracture process can be used to create a fracture in the formation, allowing for a more direct measurement of the fluid pressure.
• The invention can be used in a variety of environments, including high-temperature and high-pressure environments.

column1: • The invention provides a number of advantages over existing techniques, including improved accuracy and reliability.

column2: • It allows for the measurement of fluid pressure in geological formations with low permeability.
• The invention can be used in a variety of applications, including groundwater monitoring and petroleum exploration.",0

column1: 285,"Here is the summary of the text in 6 bullet points with 2 levels of indentation:
<summary>

* The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter.

column2: * The jointing structure ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given maintenance.

column1: * The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.

column2: * The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice versa easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.

column1: * The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and thus, the adequate management of accuracy of each member if given may be adapted to prevent the differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.

column2: * The joint block is made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path or of high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete, which is highly durable and hardly worn away.

column1: * The invention is useful in applications mainly to vehicle traveling path joints in new transit systems, monorails and the like, and besides, to road bed plate joints in road bridges, footbridges and the like.

column2: * The invention is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fallen-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given maintenance.

column1: * The elastic members may be easily joined together by mounting, across the expansion gap over the elastic members, the joint block or a backing plate used to mount the joint block.

column2: * The elastic members may be easily subjected to deformation by pressing them toward the bridge girder axis using an oil hydraulic jack or the like.

column1: 298,"<summary>
* The invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors.

column2: * It is used to monitor moving parts in mechanical systems, such as diesel engine fuel injectors.
* The sensors generate an electrical signal proportional to the distance between the moving object and a fixed position.
* The signal contains noise, including low-frequency and high-frequency noise.

column1: * The invention aims to reduce the number of wires required for sensor systems.

column2: * It uses a two-wire system, where one wire delivers operating voltage and current, and the other wire provides a ground reference.
* The sensor draws current through an external resistance, which develops a voltage drop proportional to the current.
* This voltage drop is monitored to convert the current information into voltage information.

column1: * The invention uses multiplexing to connect multiple sensors to the same set of wires.

column2: * Each sensor output is known to occur within a separate period or window of time.
* A timing signal is used to inform the injector position sensor monitoring system which injector should be operating at any specific time.
* This information is used to tag or mark the pulse train from the monitoring resistor to identify each individual sensor output.

column1: * The invention includes a waveform generator and an error correction generator.

column2: * The waveform generator modifies the sensing signal to remove unneeded power and provide a conditioned sensing signal.
* The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals.
* It uses a comparator, controller, and signal processor to provide an error correction signal.

column1: * The error correction generator includes a window reference circuit.

column2: * It constantly compares the desired conditioned sensor signal output to the existing conditioned sensor signal output.
* It adjusts the output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
* This ensures that the sensor output is close to a desired minimum value.

column1: * The invention includes a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit.

column2: * It constantly compares the sensor output to a desired minimum value.
* It generates a correction signal that is subtracted from the offset and error signal.
* This delivers a sensor output that is close to the desired minimum value.

column1: * The invention allows for rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage caused by rapid temperature or other changes.

column2: * It generates a relatively small reference signal to eliminate small values of drift.
* It generates a relatively large reference signal to accommodate rapid recalibration.
* This ensures that the sensor output is accurate and reliable.

* The invention relates to a valve actuation system for internal combustion engines, particularly a desmodromic valve actuation system that is springless and infinitely variable.

column2: * This system allows for precise control of valve timing and lift, enabling improved engine performance and fuel efficiency.

column1: * The system uses a reciprocating cam translating device coupled to a rotary cam, which receives input from a timing belt driven by the engine crankshaft.

column2: * The rotary cam has a grooved track that displaces a translating means, which reciprocates in a slot to achieve the first reciprocating linear movement.

column1: * The system includes a second device that converts the reciprocating linear motion into a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion, which is the valve itself.

column2: * The valve is attached to a rotable link with a slot that presents an angle to the line of action of the first translating means, allowing for variable valve lift.

column1: * The system can be controlled by an actuator, such as an electromechanical or hydraulic actuator, which rotates the link to adjust the valve lift.

column2: * The actuator can be controlled by a computer, allowing for real-time adjustment of valve timing and lift based on engine operating conditions.

column1: * The system can be used in a variety of engine configurations, including four-stroke engines with multiple cylinders and valves.

column2: * The system can also be used to shut off cylinders under low-load conditions, improving fuel efficiency and reducing emissions.",0

column1: 301,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine, particularly a gas turbine.

column2: * The apparatus has a hollow casting with internal cooling channels and separating walls that are inserted as separate parts, rather than being cast together with the apparatus.
* This design allows for easier production, reduced weight, and improved cooling efficiency.
* The separating walls can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be secured to the apparatus using various methods, such as soldering or welding.
* The invention addresses the disadvantages of prior art designs, including high material temperatures, thermal stresses, and complex casting processes.

column3: * The new design eliminates the large amount of material in the transitional region from the hot-gas wall to the separating wall, reducing heat transfer and cooling-air consumption.
* The design also reduces thermal stresses between the insert and the hot-gas wall, and allows for easier adjustment of the cooling system.

column2: * The invention can be applied to various types of flow deflection apparatuses, including blades in a gas turbine.

column3: * The design is particularly advantageous for rotor blades that rotate at high speed, as it reduces centrifugal-force stresses and allows for easier production.
* The invention can also be used in other applications, such as in the production of stator blades or other types of fluid-flow machines.

column2: * The invention provides a flexible and efficient solution for cooling flow deflection apparatuses, with benefits including reduced weight, improved cooling efficiency, and easier production.

column3: * The design allows for the use of various materials and manufacturing methods, and can be adapted to different applications and operating conditions.
* The invention has the potential to improve the performance and efficiency of fluid-flow machines, particularly in high-temperature applications.",0

307,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.

column2: • The mounting link is designed to withstand extreme loads, including those caused by blade-off events.
• The link includes a male and female link that can translate relative to each other, with a pin that selectively retains them.

column1: • The pin is designed to shear at a known load magnitude, allowing the links to translate and absorb extreme shocks.

column2: • The shear plane can be predefined to provide a designated area for the pin to shear.
• The pin is formed of a less durable material than the links to facilitate shear.

column1: • The links are in contact at a radial interface, which provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation.

column2: • The amount of damping is determined by the coefficient of friction, geometry, and contact areas of the links.
• The materials of the links can be selected to provide the desired level of damping.

column1: • The mounting link limits or prevents damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals by transmitting extreme loads.

column2: • The link also helps to prevent the gearbox from detaching from the engine.
• The pin can be replaced with an intact pin during maintenance following a shock sufficient to break the pin.

column1: • The invention obviates the need for all linkages and peripheral connections to be capable of surviving extreme loads.

column2: • The use of the pin and coulomb damping reduces the weight and mass of material required to reinforce associated systems.
• The invention provides a more efficient and effective way to absorb extreme shocks.

column1: • The mounting link can be used in various applications, including aircraft gas turbine engines.

column2: • The link can be used to connect the engine to an auxiliary gearbox or other attached structures.
• The link can be designed to meet specific requirements and constraints of different applications.

column1: • The invention provides a technical solution to the problem of extreme loads caused by blade-off events.

column2: • The solution is based on the use of a pin that shears at a known load magnitude and a radial interface that provides coulomb damping.
• The invention provides a more reliable and efficient way to absorb extreme shocks and prevent damage to the gearbox and its attached peripherals.

column1: • The invention can be modified and varied to meet specific requirements and constraints of different applications.

column2: • The invention is not limited to the embodiments described, and many modifications and variations are possible.

column1: • The simulator has several objects, including providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, providing an inexpensive means for realistic training, and providing a reliable and low-maintenance device.

column2: • The simulator achieves these objects through its electronic control circuit, which includes a bolt interface, trigger interface, oscillator control, and firing control.

• The simulator also includes a MILES interface to connect to a Multiple Integrated Laser Engagement System.

column1: • The simulator uses a pyrotechnic charge composed of potassium perchlorate, black powdered aluminum, and dextrose, which is sealed in a plastic cup and electrically ignited.

column2: • The pyrotechnic charge produces a rapid increase in pressure when ignited, which ruptures the plastic sealant and vents through the exit port.
• The shock of the rupture and the venting of pressure simulate the sound and flash of small arms fire.
• The simulator can be used for training with an M16 rifle and can be adapted for use with other weapons.

column1: • The invention has several advantages, including providing a realistic simulation of small arms fire, reducing training costs, and increasing training safety.

• The burner system consists of a combustion chamber, fuel holder, and outer shroud, which work together to provide efficient and clean burning of solid fuels.

column2: • The combustion chamber is enclosed by an outer wall and has a constricted exhaust outlet, which helps to concentrate heat and flames.

column1: • The system includes a modular design, allowing for interchangeable heat utilizing appliances to be attached, such as cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.

column2: • Each appliance is designed for a specific purpose, such as cooking, smoking, or heating, and can be easily attached and detached from the burner.

column1: 313,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a rotary internal combustion engine with improved cooling and ignition systems.

column2: * The cooling system features a circumferential flow passageway with staggered spark plug bosses that promote controlled flow and heat transfer.
* The ignition system uses multiple spark plugs with terminals offset from the centerline of the trochoid wall to improve combustion efficiency.
* The staggered boss arrangement reduces thermal distortion and improves heat transfer by up to 44% compared to in-line arrangements.

column3: * The invention allows for separate flow paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer, reducing thermal hotspots.
* The design enables a more uniform temperature gradient across the gas side of the wall, reducing the risk of thermal failure.

314,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to turbines and a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.

column2: * The method uses control valve positions as feedback to minimize flow disturbance, maintaining total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves constant.

column1: * The invention is a compensation function that adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance caused by the closure and reopening of a turbine control valve during testing.

column2: * The compensation function is based on the difference in flow characteristics between the system with N valves and the system with N-1 valves, and uses a ""look-up table"" to provide the required flow compensation for a given mass flow demand.

315,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines fluids from two separate sources into one mixture.

column2: * The valve has two inlets and one outlet, and the outlet mixture can range from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
* The valve is designed for use in the commercial airline industry, where aircraft are typically cleaned extensively on a yearly basis.
* The valve allows multiple users to accomplish specific cleaning tasks without disrupting others.

column1: * The valve system includes a valve body, a first inlet passage, a second inlet passage, an outlet passage, and a valve means.

column2: * The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
* The valve body defines a bore and a series of passages that connect the inlets to the outlet.
* The valve means includes a spool valve and a handle that rotates to adjust the mixture.

column1: * The spool valve includes a series of cylindrical spools and channels that retain fluid seal rings.

column2: * The fluid seal rings prevent commingling of the two fluid sources within the valve body and prevent leakage.
* The spool valve is designed to be slidably received within the valve body.
* The handle is connected to the spool valve and rotates to adjust the mixture.

column1: * The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the two fluids emerging from the outlet.

column2: * The system includes flow-reducing devices to reduce the flow rate of each fluid.
* The maximum flow rate of each fluid occurs only when the corresponding bore is axially aligned with its respective passages.
* This design allows multiple identical valve systems to operate from a common fluid source without affecting fluid pressure.",0

column1: 316,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.

column2: • The method includes compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling the gas by heat exchange, and expanding the gas to a lower pressure to achieve the desired exit temperature.
• The invention also relates to an arrangement for carrying out the method, including compressors, heat exchangers, and valves.
• The prior art uses re-cooling plants with separate cooling cycles, which are expensive and pose safety risks.
• The present invention aims to reduce investments and operation risks.
• The method involves compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
• The invention provides a more efficient and cost-effective solution for gas compression in permanent frost areas.

317,"<summary>
• Electronic components produce heat, and in some applications, free convection cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating.

column2: • Heat can be removed using electric fans, which are often integrated with an enclosure that houses the electronic components.
• The use of fans is a low-cost solution for keeping components within acceptable temperature ranges.
• Fans are typically mounted to the enclosure using fasteners, which increases the product cost due to labor and tooling.
• The invention disclosed herein eliminates the need for fasteners.

column1: • The cooling fan assembly is designed to be mounted to a panel, which can be a sheet-like stationary member.

column2: • The assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and motor carrier with mounting legs that terminate in resilient leg portions.
• The panel has recessed portions with openings that correspond to the mounting legs.
• The motor carrier also includes spring members that urge it away from the panel.

column1: • The installation process involves positioning the cooling fan assembly against the panel, then applying a compressive and rotating force to move it into place.

column2: • The turned-out portions of the mounting legs enter an enlarged opening in the panel, then a smaller intermediate opening, and finally a residual opening.
• The spring members compress and then expand to capture the mounting legs in the residual opening.
• The assembly is secured in place by the spring members, which prevent vibrational noise and movement.

column1: • The invention is applicable in various industries, including automotive, computer, and electronic instrumentation.

column2: • The motor can be electric, hydraulic, or pneumatic, and may include electronic motor control components.
• The fan blade moves warm air out of the enclosure and ambient air enters through intake portals.
• The invention is not limited to cooling electronic components, but can be used in any application where forced air movement is necessary.

column1: • The invention provides a low-cost solution for mounting cooling fans to enclosures without the need for fasteners.

column2: • The design is flexible and can be adapted to various applications and industries.
• The spring members provide a secure and reliable mounting system.
• The invention reduces labor and tooling costs associated with traditional fastening methods.",0

column1: 318,"<summary>

* Spacecraft structures require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have low damping and vibration dissipation characteristics, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise instrument functionality.

column2: * This is particularly problematic for instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM), which have very little inherent damping.
* 14% of spacecraft launches through 1984 suffered vibration/shock related failures, with 50% resulting in catastrophic mission loss.

column1: * Current efforts to modify graphite structures to reduce vibration response may not be sufficient to meet instrument design levels.

column2: * Additional vibration reduction techniques are needed to protect instruments from flight loads.
* The need for improved kinematic mounts is critical.

column1: * Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration transmission to instruments.

column2: * These mounts are designed to safely carry launch loads but do not minimize loads transmitted to the instrument.
* The six suspension modes introduced by these mounts have very little damping, amplifying flight loads to the instrument.

column1: * The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features.

column2: * The invention incorporates a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads.
* The mounts can be incorporated into existing KM structures.

column1: * The invention uses a damped instrument kinematic mount with instrument support means and first and second damping means.

column2: * The damping means and instrument support means are arranged to provide desired performance characteristics.
* The device can be applied to precision or optical instruments/sensors where alignment stability is important.

column1: * The invention modifies kinematic mounts by inserting vibration damping materials into the mounts.

column2: * The damping materials introduce a damping mechanism into the six mount suspension modes, dissipating energy into heat.
* The modifications preserve the fundamental features of the kinematic mounts, such as strength, stiffness, and kinematic features.

column1: * Two embodiments of the damper design are presented, using spherical and cylindrical slot dampers.

column2: * The dampers use viscoelastic materials that dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat.
* The materials have frequency-dependent properties that allow for high damping at high frequencies and low stiffness at low frequencies.

column1: * The invention provides a kinematic mounting scheme that uses six identical strut elements, reducing manufacturing complexity and costs.

column2: * The scheme can be arranged to approximately uncouple the mount suspension modes, improving KM performance.
* The invention achieves modal vibration tests with damping values from 5-17% of critical damping, significantly higher than existing designs.

column1: * The invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts",0
319,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a clutch unit of the oil shear type, particularly for use in large size applications such as aircraft catapult systems.

column2: * The clutch unit has interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates.

column1: * The invention provides improved cooling through better oil flow control, and minimizes disc friction on the disc stack for improved torque control.

column2: * The segmental disc arrangement allows for convenient inspection and replacement of individual disc segments without disassembling the entire unit.

column1: * The clutch unit uses a centrifugal force-based retraction system, eliminating the need for retraction springs.

column2: * The system minimizes residual drag, which is critical in high-capacity clutch units.

* The engine can achieve high thermal efficiency by capturing and reusing heat energy that would otherwise be lost, and can reduce emissions by catalyzing reactions within the engine.

column3: * The engine can be configured in various ways, including with multiple expansion cylinders and cascaded cylinders.

321,"<summary>

* The invention relates to the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat-treated to obtain parts having good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance.

column2: * The coated steel plate has a precoat consisting of an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, and an area at the periphery of the plate has the metal alloy layer removed.

column1: * The invention provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate that includes coating a steel plate to obtain a precoat having an intermetallic alloy layer topped by a metal alloy layer, and then removing the metal alloy layer in an area not totally contiguous with the periphery of the plate.

column2: * The removal of the metal alloy layer can be done by brushing or laser ablation, and the width of the area from which the metal alloy has been removed is adjusted to ensure that the metal coating is not introduced into the molten metal during subsequent welding.

column1: * The invention also provides a method of fabricating a part that includes welding the precoated steel plates, heating the welded blank to form an intermetallic alloy compound, and then hot deforming the blank to obtain a part with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance.

column2: * The part can have a martensitic, bainitic, or bainitic-martensitic microstructure, and the corrosion resistance is ensured by the intermetallic alloy compound formed during the heat treatment.

column1: * The invention is particularly useful for the fabrication of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles.

column2: * The parts fabricated according to the invention have good mechanical characteristics, corrosion resistance, and can be used in various applications, including the automotive industry.",1

column1: 322,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to a remote control system for a mobile energy recovery structure that optimizes energy extraction from severe weather patterns.

column2: • The system includes a Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) system that gathers data from various sources, including weather satellites, GPS, and sensors on the mobile structure.
• The SCADA system uses this data to optimize the mobile structure's position and velocity to maximize energy extraction.
• The system also includes a control algorithm that adjusts the mobile structure's controls, such as rudder rotation and sail trim, to optimize energy extraction.
• The system can be controlled remotely from a central service facility, and can also operate autonomously.
• The system can be used for various types of mobile energy recovery structures, including sailing vessels and propelled vessels.

323,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures arranged in succession in the circumferential direction.

column2: * The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined to one another in succession in the circumferential direction and connected, in particular welded, to one another in a production step which precedes the formation of the axial profiling.
* The invention reduces the production costs and cutting waste in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages produced by forming techniques.

column3: * The process costs associated with the formation of three weld joints are lower than the material costs of the cutting waste.
* The invention is particularly advantageous in the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm.

column1: * The flat material ring segments are put together across an engagement zone and in this engagement zone are welded along edge regions which face one other therein.

column2: * The joint contours form an undercut geometry which preliminarily couples the ring elements to one another in the circumferential direction.

column3: * The geometric profile of the joint contours is selected such that adequate coupling of the ring segments is produced with as short as possible a weld seam length.

* The joint contours are configured such that the weld seams taper both towards the ring element inner circumferential edge and towards the ring element outer circumferential edge with as obtuse an angle as possible.

column1: * The flat material ring segments are cut out, in particular punched out, from a sheet metal material.

column2: * A relatively high material saving can be achieved in that the flat material ring segments are formed as 120° ring segments.

column3: * Only three weld points are then required for joining together a ring element from such flat material ring segments.
* The 120° segments can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip.

* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, particularly magnetic fields, using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit.

column2: * The system can compensate for both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields, and can simulate the measurement of electromagnetic interfering fields at the location of the object to be protected.
* The system can also equalize potentially arising feedback effects when two magnetic field compensation systems are used in immediate vicinity.

column3: * The control unit uses a digital signal processor or field programmable gate array to process the output signals from the sensors and generate control signals for the coils.
* The system can be used in various applications, including scanning electron microscopes (SEM) and other devices that require magnetic field compensation.",0

column1: 326,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy.

column2: • The method involves sensing a resonance signal generated by coherent anti-Stokes Raman scattering by excitation of at least one resonance site of the sample by means of laser irradiation.

column1: • The method furnishes at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one further reaction partner.

column2: • The bioorthogonal reaction introduces a corresponding structure that is not inherently contained in the sample.

column1: • The invention is particularly suitable for tagging in biological samples, such as nerve tissue, and allows for simultaneous checking of lipids for tags and processing them in image-producing fashion.

column2: • This was previously only possible separately.

column1: • The method can also be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures that are normally not detectable by means of CARS microscopy.

column2: • This is achieved by introducing small molecules that can be introduced deep into a corresponding tissue.

column1: • The use of bioorthogonal reactions typically encompasses two steps: equipping a cellular substrate with a bioorthogonal functional group, and introducing a tagging substance with a complementary functional group.

column2: • The bioorthogonal functional group must not substantially modify the structure of the sample.

column1: • The method allows for dedicated detection of target sites in any samples, for example in cells, without negatively affecting biochemical processes that may continue to occur.

column2: • The tagging reaction causes the actual synthesis or introduction of the ""active"" substance for CARS image production.

column1: • The invention enables a reproducible counter-staining of the non-resonant background in the context of CARS microscopy.

column2: • This is achieved by introducing a defined background signal that can be correlated with the signal component attributable to intrinsic resonance sites of the sample.

327,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy.

column2: • The system compares segmentations from different sources, such as clinicians or autosegmentation programs.
• The system provides a tool for training, evaluation, and product evaluation purposes.

column1: • The system accepts electronic files providing data points describing different three-dimensional surfaces circumscribing a structure in a human patient.

column2: • The files are used to generate a first and second volume model, per ROI, defined by the first and second electronic file respectively.
• The volume models are compared to identify common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements.

column1: • The system provides a metric method to measure the conformance between the segmentations.

column2: • The metric method may be a combination of a constant value, a linear function of a number of error volume elements with distance, and an exponential function of the number of error volume elements with distance.
• The metric method may be customized by the user.

column1: • The system displays the results of the comparison in a graphical format.

column2: • The display shows the common volume elements, missing volume elements, and extra volume elements in different colors.
• The display may be superimposed on a medical image of the structure.

column1: • The system provides a quantitative evaluation of the comparison of the two segmentations.

column2: • The evaluation includes the primary volume, secondary volume, missing volume, extra volume, and metric method/metric score.
• The evaluation may be displayed in a table or histogram.

column1: • The system may be used in the training of clinicians, quality assurance testing of anatomy auto-segmentation routines, and assessment of auto-segmentation routines or systems.

column2: • The system may be used to make assessments of anatomy auto-segmentation routines or systems prior to customer purchase or clinical application.
• The system may be used to assess whether a new treatment plan should be prepared based on changes in the internal anatomy of the patient during radiation therapy.

328,"<summary>
• The invention relates to data processing systems and floating point operations

column2: • The floating point format has a disadvantage of complex and time-consuming addition and subtraction operations
• The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit

column1: • The effective subtraction operation involves aligning fractions, subtracting, and normalizing the result

column2: • The invention uses a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the operation
• The subset difference is used to begin the subtraction procedure prior to the complete difference being available

column1: • The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference in exponent arguments

column2: • One procedure is used when the absolute value is greater than 1, and the other when it is less than or equal to 1
• The procedures reduce the number of steps required for the effective subtraction operation

column1: • The invention uses a technique to reduce the time to execute the effective subtraction operation

column2: • The technique involves determining the difference between the exponent arguments and aligning the fractions on the fly
• The technique reduces the number of steps required for the effective subtraction operation

column1: • The invention uses a block diagram to illustrate the apparatus implementing the invention

column2: • The apparatus includes a subtraction unit, detection logic unit, shift and selection logic unit, and selection logic unit
• The apparatus accelerates the effective subtraction operation by calculating a difference between an subset of signal positions of an operand exponent argument

column1: • The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation by initiating the subtraction procedure prior to the complete difference being available

column2: • The invention uses the subset difference to determine the correct resulting fraction
• The correct resulting fraction is available based on the differences between the complete operand exponent arguments

column1: • The invention provides an improved data processing system and apparatus for executing floating point operations

column2: • The invention accelerates the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit
• The invention uses a technique to reduce the time to execute the effective subtraction operation

column1: • The invention is not limited to the preferred embodiment described

column2: • The scope of the invention is to be limited only by the claims
• The invention has many variations that would yet be encompassed by the spirit and scope of the invention",0

* The present invention relates to the field of semiconductor design technology, specifically to systems and techniques used for implementing circuit designs into silicon based integrated circuits (ICs).

column2: * It addresses the problem of design rule checking (DRC) for ICs that include both logic and memory circuits, which have different sizing, performance, and scaling issues.

332,"<summary>
• This invention relates to the use of waveguide holograms as illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators.

column2: • The invention uses thin substrate waveguides, which are characterized by the relationship between the width of the incident laser beam and the thickness of the waveguide.
• The waveguide holograms can be used to provide controlled illumination of objects, with high diffraction efficiencies and minimal stray light.

column1: • The invention has several advantages over conventional illumination systems, including compactness, ruggedness, and reduced reflection losses.

column2: • The waveguide hologram illuminator occupies much less space than conventional lens illumination systems.
• The active volume of the waveguide hologram illuminator is significantly smaller than that of conventional systems.

column1: • The diffraction efficiency of the waveguide hologram illuminator can be high, with values approaching 0.99.

column2: • The absence of stray light propagating forward to the observer is also an advantage of the waveguide hologram illuminator.
• The undiffracted light is trapped in the waveguide, reducing noise and increasing efficiency.

column1: • However, there are some penalties to be paid, including critical alignment of the laser beam and time delay across the hologram.

column2: • Nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction is also a challenge that must be addressed.
• Compensation for illumination depletion can be done a priori or a posteriori.

column1: • The invention has been demonstrated using two basic architectures for recording the waveguide hologram grating.

column2: • The first configuration uses a modified conventional holographic recording system, while the second configuration is suitable for waveguides with more stringent requirements.
• The quality of the reconstructed beams was analyzed from various points of view, including polarization and phase characteristics.

333,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, particularly squirrel cage rotors for induction motors.

column2: • The apparatus includes a test head with a core of magnetic material and a set of primary windings that create an alternating magnetic field when energized.
• The test head also includes voltage and skew sensing pick-up coils that measure the rotor's response to the magnetic field.
• The apparatus further includes a data acquisition and processing system that calculates the rotor's resistance, reactance, and effective skew from the sensed data.

column1: • The test method involves rotating the rotor within the test head while applying an alternating current to the primary windings.

column2: • The voltage and skew sensing coils measure the rotor's response to the magnetic field, and the data is sampled and processed to calculate the rotor's characteristics.
• The calculated values are then compared to predetermined threshold values to determine if the rotor is acceptable or defective.
• The apparatus can also store statistical data for multiple tests to enable quality control and process monitoring.

column1: • The test apparatus includes a retraction and drive mechanism that retracts the rotor to the test position and rotates it during the test sequence.

column2: • The mechanism includes a spindle with a shaft and annular sleeves that hold the rotor in place during rotation.
• The apparatus also includes a hydraulic cylinder that retracts the mechanism to the test position.
• The test sequence is controlled by a control processor that activates the drive motor and retraction mechanism.

column1: • The invention provides a non-destructive, economical, and reliable method for testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, enabling quality control and process monitoring.

column2: • The apparatus can be used to test rotors of various sizes and types.
• The test method is automatic and does not require operator intervention during the test sequence.
• The apparatus provides detailed statistical data for multiple tests, enabling quality control and process monitoring.",0

column1: 334,"<summary>
* The present disclosure relates to securing a mobile device by controlling access to native resources of an operating system.

column2: * The mobile device includes a trusted layer of software, such as the operating system and native applications, and an arbitration layer that gates access to the operating system.
* The arbitration layer includes a manager that restricts access to native resources based on digital certificates associated with managed libraries and applications.
* The manager grants access to native resources to managed libraries with valid digital certificates and denies access to managed applications without valid certificates.

column3: * The digital certificates are used to authenticate the managed libraries and applications and to determine the level of access to native resources.
* The manager can terminate a managed application that attempts to access native resources without a valid digital certificate.

column1: * The present disclosure also relates to a method of securing a computing device, including granting access to native resources to a managed library with a valid digital certificate and denying access to a managed application without a valid digital certificate.

column2: * The method includes validating a digital certificate associated with a managed library, granting access to native resources to the managed library, and denying access to native resources to a managed application without a valid digital certificate.

column3: * The method can also include verifying a digital signature associated with a container that includes the managed application and loading the managed application.
* The method can also include accessing native functions of the operating system through instructions for a runtime host, which are effectuated by native instructions.

column2: * The card has a core layer with a silica-filled polyolefin material.

column2: * The card has two relatively shock-absorbing layers, which may contain indicia.

column1: * The core layer is formed from an opaque sheet of printable silica-filled polyolefin.

column2: * The first indicium or indicia are formed by any known process capable of forming the indicium on the specific core material used.
* A modified laser printer is used to apply the first indicium in the present process.

column1: * Alkyd resin spids containing an anti-binding agent are printed onto one side of the shrunken core sheet.

column2: * Antennae, typically silver-epoxy antennae, are then printed onto the spids in a matching pattern.

column1: * The core layer with attached antennae and IC chips is then bonded to a bottom sheet of printable, silica-filled polyolefin with an adhesive layer.

column2: * The adhesive layer may be composed of a number of commercially available adhesives.

* The thickness of the polymer layers is not critical, although it is generally preferred that the thickness of each polymer layer be at least about 0.1 mm.

column1: * The image-receiving layer of the present identification document may be formed of any material capable of receiving an image by dye diffusion thermal transfer.

column1: 336,"<summary>
* The invention relates to the implementation of a memory, specifically a queue, in a functional memory environment.

column2: * The queue is implemented as a tree-shaped data structure with nodes of a given maximum size.
* Each node has a type field and an element table with pointers to child nodes or records.
* The tree is balanced, meaning all leaf nodes are at the same level, and nodes are filled upwards.

column1: * The invention provides a method for adding and deleting records from the queue.

column2: * Additions are made to the first non-full node on the edge of the tree, and deletions are made from the leaf node on the edge of the tree.
* The method ensures that the tree remains balanced and nodes are filled upwards.

column1: * A header node can be added to the memory structure to improve performance.

column2: * The header node has three elements, each pointing to the end, middle, or beginning of the queue.
* The header node can be used to invert the queue in constant time and space.

column1: * The invention can be used to implement a double-ended queue (deque) with additions and deletions possible at both ends.

column2: * The queue can be inverted by changing the value of an inversion bit.
* The invention can be used in various applications, such as memory management and data processing.",0

column1: 337,"<summary>
• The invention relates to electrically programmable read-only memory (EPROM) devices manufactured by existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies.

column2: • The EPROM devices can be used for DRAM redundancy circuits, allowing for programmable devices without the need for special technologies.
• The EPROM devices can also be used for other applications, such as programmable firmware on logic circuits and security purposes.
• The invention provides a method to build EPROM devices using existing DRAM manufacturing procedures, reducing the cost and complexity of production.

column3: • The EPROM devices use DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, allowing for higher gate coupling ratios and lower operation voltages.
• The EPROM devices can be programmed and erased using electrical procedures, making them more convenient than current art EPROM devices.

column1: • The invention also provides a method to build EPROM devices without using floating gate devices, instead using the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors.

column2: • This type of EPROM device is called stress effect programmable read-only memory (SEPROM) devices.

column3: • SEPROM devices can be manufactured by any IC technology and are ideal for embedded applications.
• SEPROM devices have the advantage of being highly secure, as the data stored is not detectable by physical analysis.",0

column1: 338,"<summary>

339,"Here is the summary of the text in 10 bullet points with 2 levels of indentation:
<summary>
* The invention relates to zoom lenses with a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio, particularly suited for photographic cameras and video cameras.

column2: * The goal is to achieve a high relative aperture and a high zoom ratio while minimizing the size of the lens.

column1: * The prior art has limitations in terms of size and optical performance, particularly for video cameras with a 2/3 inch image pickup tube.

column2: * The prior art lenses have a total length of around 10φA to 12φA, which is considered long.

column1: * The invention aims to provide a zoom lens with a small F-number, a high zoom ratio, and a standard image angle at the wide angle end, while minimizing the size of the lens.

column2: * The lens consists of five lens units, including a first lens unit of positive power, a second lens unit of negative power, a third lens unit of negative power, a fourth lens unit of positive power, and a fifth lens unit with an image forming function.

column1: * The fourth lens unit has a bi-convex lens with a strong rear surface curvature, and the fifth lens unit has a specific arrangement of lenses to correct aberrations.

column2: * The lens units are designed to satisfy certain conditions, including the refractive power of the rear surface of the first lens in the fourth lens unit, the refractive power ratio of the second lens in the fifth lens unit, and the Abbe numbers of the media of the first and sixth lenses in the fifth lens unit.

column1: * The invention achieves a reduction of the physical length of the entire lens system while minimizing the variation of aberrations with zooming.

column2: * The total length of the lens is reduced to around 9.13φA to 9.19φA, which is a significant improvement over the prior art.

column1: * The invention provides four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses that satisfy the conditions and achieve high optical performance.

column2: * The examples demonstrate the effectiveness of the invention in achieving a high relative aperture, high zoom ratio, and small size.",0

column1: 340,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons.

column2: * The method involves generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through, converting the pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying and processing the signal.

column1: * The device includes a detector, a first amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second amplifier for integrating multiple signals.

column2: * The device can detect individual particles and integrate multiple particles, allowing for both high-resolution detection and high-rate detection.

column1: * The invention uses a low-voltage-side discharge of the detector to prevent leakage currents and improve signal-to-noise ratio.

column2: * The low-voltage-side discharge also enables the use of a support capacitor to rapidly compensate for detector discharging.

column1: * The device can be used in various applications, including particle accelerators, reactor installations, and medical diagnostic devices.

column2: * The invention allows for the detection of both charged and uncharged particles, and can be used to measure particle rates and intensities.

column1: * The device can be optimized for specific particle detection tasks, such as detecting packets of particles or measuring particle beam formation.

column2: * The invention provides a flexible and adaptable solution for detecting elementary particles in various contexts.",0

column1: 341,"<summary>
• The invention relates to an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.

column2: • The apparatus includes a test enclosure with a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards and away from each other.
• The movable ring is connected to a servo motor that controls its movement.

column1: • The driven disc assembly is mounted on a hub within the test enclosure and is frictionally engaged between the two rings.

column2: • The apparatus includes a torque motor that exerts a predetermined amount of torque on the hub to rotate the driven disc assembly.

column1: • The apparatus includes sensors to measure the distance between the rings and the rotation of the driven disc assembly.

column2: • The sensors provide signals to a microprocessor that controls the operation of the apparatus and determines whether the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances.

column1: • The microprocessor actuates the servo motor to move the movable ring away from the stationary ring at a slow speed.

column2: • The microprocessor reads the signals from the sensors to determine when the driven disc assembly begins to rotate and calculates the amount of warpage in the assembly.

column1: • The apparatus provides an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.

column2: • The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control and minimize operator error.

342,"<summary>
* The invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor.

column2: * It involves estimating an age of a person represented in image data.

column1: * The present disclosure is directed to methods and software that include steps and/or machine-readable instructions for estimating an age of a person represented in first image data.

column2: * The first image data represents an image of one or more persons' faces for which ages are desired to be estimated.

column1: * A contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from face images.

column2: * The CAM is a combination of shape variation and texture variation, which can represent both the shape structure of a face and its constituent parts.

column1: * The CAM result encodes correlations between the parameters of the shape model and those of the texture model across the training set.

column2: * The final training images can be represented according to Equation 6.

column1: * Support Vector Regression (SVR) is used to construct two differently-calibrated aging functions, a growth and development mapping function and an adult aging mapping function.

column2: * SVR is used to build a hyper-plane as close to as many of the training points as possible.

column1: * A binary classifier is built by SVMs to distinguish youths from adults.

column2: * The classifier is configured using a Gaussian kernel, which may generate the best classification rate among possible kernel functions.

column1: * In the testing phase, the CAM algorithm is used to extract a feature vector from the first image data.

column2: * The individual represented by the first image data is recognized as a youth or an adult by the SVM-trained youth/adult classifier.

column1: * An estimated age is generated using the growth and development or adult aging function, as appropriate.

column2: * The estimated age may be provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, optionally with a corresponding confidence factor.",0

column1: 343,"<summary>

column1: 347,"<summary>
• The invention relates to locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, especially when a second object is adjacent to the first.

column2: • The prior art uses passive or active techniques, including gradiometers and magnetic locators, but these methods can be distorted by the presence of adjacent objects.

column1: • The invention provides a system and method for improving the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.

column2: • The system includes a transmitter and a receiver, with the transmitter inducing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects and the receiver sensing the associated magnetic fields.

column1: • The transmitter has a pair of antennae that are spaced apart and driven by RF signals, generating corresponding magnetic fields that induce currents in the cables.

column2: • The antennae may be oriented horizontally or vertically to enhance the inducement of currents in the respective cables.

column1: • The transmitting apparatus is optimally positioned relative to the cables, with the antennae spaced a few feet apart and centered over the cables.

column2: • The system can produce two distinct output signal nulls over the respective cables, making it possible to locate and trace one of the cables more easily and accurately.

column1: • The invention uses distinguishable currents in the respective cables, which can be achieved through different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different repetition rates.

column2: • The receiver detects the beat frequency signal produced by the combination of the currents and produces an output signal dependent upon the presence of both currents.

column1: • The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced.

column2: • The effect of the invention is enhanced by the fact that the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between an antenna and a cable.",0

column1: 351,"<summary>
* The invention relates to a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, such as a television or monitor.

column2: * The device is designed to reduce glare and reflections on the screen.

column1: * The prior art device has several disadvantages, including the need for a special fastening device and a bulky design.

column2: * The prior art device also requires the user to sit directly in front of the screen.

353,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera.

column1: • The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam to make the scanning beam run successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane.

column2: • The device includes a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator, and a beam suppression circuit.

column1: • The cyclic line counter carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses, where N/p is an integer >1.

column2: • The end-of-count pulse is applied to the beam suppression circuit for picture beam suppression.

column1: • The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam.

column2: • The sawtooth generator and beam suppression circuit are controlled via a delay device, which is triggered by the output of the counter.

column1: • The device allows for a higher picture sequence frequency than conventional TV cameras.

column2: • The picture sequence frequency can be increased by a factor of 40 or more.

column2: • The device is an improvement over film cameras with rotating mirrors, which were not suited for immediate analysis by a computer.",0

column1: 354,"<summary>
• The present invention relates to multimedia communications and handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services.

column2: • It provides a solution in the packet domain for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call.
• The invention uses a multimedia server associated with a telephony server, with software that manages blended calls.
• The software, referred to as a blender, initiates parallel voice and multimedia components for a single session.

column1: • The blender receives a call request and initiates two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.

column2: • The voice call component is handled through the telephony server, and the multimedia call component is handled through the multimedia server.
• The blender integrates the signaling paths into a single signal path as part of the single session.
• The single signal path is used by the multimedia server to control the bearer paths associated with the call.

column1: • The invention is designed to prolong the viability of existing network devices by allowing existing customer premises equipment and existing network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities.

column2: • The invention uses a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration.
• The communication environment includes a communication network, clients, customer premises equipment, telephony servers, database servers, and multimedia servers.
• The invention takes incoming and outgoing calls associated with a client and routes the call to the blender associated with the telephony server.

column1: • The blender separates the call request into a call component and a multimedia request, and sends the call request back to the telephony server with an indication that the call request is coming from the blender.

column2: • The telephony server rings the telephone type device, and the blender sends the multimedia request to the computer type device.
• The multimedia server maintains control over the signaling paths associated with the blended session.
• The invention allows for the provision of multimedia services without requiring the replacement of existing network devices or customer premises equipment.",0

column1: 355,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to content synchronization frameworks using dynamic attributes and file bundles for connected devices.

column2: * It provides a central reference point that accepts context from a connected client device and constructs a response compatible with the device and user.

column1: * The framework prioritizes download order of files described in the response bundle and downloads the files to the connected device in the download order.

column2: * It confirms complete download of the files described in the response bundle and rejects incompletely downloaded bundles of files.

column1: * The system and method are highly scalable due to the client device performing a major portion of processing.

column2: * It supports both synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices or appliances.

column1: * The framework supports content synchronization at any point in time based on device context, which may be in the form of arbitrary dynamic attributes sent to the central reference point by the client.

column2: * It employs file compression and concurrent priority-based downloading to optimize the synchronization algorithm and communication bandwidth usage.

column1: * The system and method provide for creation of a delta list embodying differences between a client's local copy of a file or data and the central reference point indicated file or data.

column2: * It distributes the work to the client device, making it highly scalable, and the central reference point server does not need to store the state of each client device.

column1: 357,"<summary>
* The invention relates to electron multipliers and their use in photomultipliers and particle detectors.

column2: * Electron multipliers amplify incident particles, such as electrons, ions, or photons, to produce a detectable signal.
* The invention provides a new type of electron multiplier, called a foil electron multiplier.
* The foil electron multiplier uses a series of thin foils to amplify incident particles.

column1: * The foil electron multiplier has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers.

column2: * It has a higher gain per stage, resulting in fewer required stages.
* It is simpler and less expensive to fabricate.
* It can cover a larger area and is more robust.
* It has intrinsic rejection of ion feedback.

column1: * The foil electron multiplier consists of a series of thin foils held in an evacuated enclosure.

column2: * Each foil is biased to accelerate secondary electrons to the next stage.
* The foils are arranged collinearly, but can also be arranged in an array.
* The anode collects the amplified electrons and can be made of a scintillator material.

column1: * The gain of the foil electron multiplier is maximized by optimizing the foil thickness, transmission through the support grid, and secondary electron emission yield.

column2: * The foil thickness should be minimized to reduce the required stage bias.
* The support grid should have a high transmission to minimize loss of electrons.
* The secondary electron emission yield should be maximized by optimizing the voltage per stage.

column1: * The foil electron multiplier does not experience ion feedback, which is a limitation of conventional electron multipliers.

column2: * Ions generated at a stage are accelerated towards the previous stage, but cannot penetrate the foil.
* The resulting avalanche is indistinguishable in time from the initial avalanche.
* This eliminates the need for curved channels to prevent ion feedback.

column1: * The invention has been demonstrated using a foil electron multiplier with 2, 3, and 4 stages.

column2: * The multiplier gain was measured as a function of the applied voltage.
* The results showed a higher gain per stage than conventional electron multipliers.
* The data agreed well with the theoretical model.</summary>",0

column1: 358,"<summary>

column1: * The 3-D Phenomenoscope consists of viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses.

column2: * The lenses can be clear, darkened, or partially occluded.

column2: * The images are processed by a computer processor to identify lateral movement and synchronization events.

column1: * The processor controls the state of the lenses based on the identified synchronization events.

column2: * This creates the 3D effect for the viewer.

column1: * The invention works with any viewing media, including TV, film, DVD, computer monitor, and more.

column2: * It can be used with older motion pictures or those produced before the invention.

column1: * The 3-D Phenomenoscope overcomes problems of providing 3-dimensional illusions in motion pictures.

column2: * It achieves several benefits, including no special equipment needed for filming or projection.

column1: * The invention reduces eyestrain and discomfort by only activating the 3D effect when sustained lateral motion is detected.

column2: * It is a battery-powered, intelligent system that works in real-time.

360,"<summary>
* The present invention relates to a field emission display device having a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission components.

column2: * The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects ionic emission gas away from the field emission components.
* The reduction plate or electrode is negatively charged to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions, preventing them from contacting the cathode and inducing surging electrical currents.

column1: * The field emission display device includes a cathode, an anode, and multiple field emission elements that emit high-energy electrons.

column2: * The electrons strike molecular nitrogen and oxygen, forming positive ions that are deflected away from the cathode by the reduction plate or electrode.

column1: * The protection structure can be fabricated in various shapes, including elongated and parallel, or meshwork- or net-shaped.

column2: * The reduction plates or electrodes can be formed on the cathode plate, separated by an insulation layer.

column1: * The invention provides a novel protection structure for preventing burn-out damage to field emission elements in a field emission display device.

column2: * The protection structure prolongs the lifetime of the field emission elements and prevents current-induced damage.

362,"<summary>
• The invention relates to home networks employing devices with power management systems.

column2: • The goal is to minimize power consumption while ensuring optimal network administration.
• Power management is desirable due to the high energy consumption of network appliances.

column1: • Current home networks have a network master node that performs administrative functions, even when not performing its nominal device functions.

column2: • This leads to unnecessary energy consumption, contradicting Energy Star guidelines.
• It would be advantageous to turn off or put the network master node into power save mode when not performing its nominal device functions.

column1: • A proposed solution is to have a network slave node promote itself to become the new network master node when the current master node fails or goes offline.

column2: • However, this may not result in the most qualified device becoming the new master node.
• The network may be lost if no slave nodes are available to promote.

column1: • The invention provides methods for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.

column2: • This allows the master device to enter power save mode while ensuring the network is still administered.
• The transfer of functions is done in a way that ensures the most qualified device becomes the new master node.

column1: • The home network includes devices capable of serving as both network master and slave nodes, and devices that can only serve as slave nodes.

column2: • Each device has a device manager, power manager, and a network interface.
• The network interface enables communication between devices and the performance of network administrative functions.

column1: • The network master node performs network administrative functions, such as beacon transmission, device association, and bandwidth assignment.

column2: • The master node periodically broadcasts a beacon to each slave node.
• The master node manages all traffic on the network and assigns bandwidth to slave nodes.

column1: • When a master node is instructed to enter power save mode, it sends data enabling network administrative functions to a slave node.

column2: • The slave node becomes the new master node, and the old master node enters power save mode.
• This process minimizes power consumption while ensuring the network is still administered.

column1: • The invention provides a means for selecting the most qualified slave node to become the new master node.

column2: • The selection criteria can be based on visibility, intelligence, or functional capabilities.
• The selection process ensures the network is always administered by the most capable device.

column1: • The invention allows for the transfer of network administrative functions while the slave node is performing its nominal device functions.

column2: • The transfer can also be done intermittently or after the slave node has performed its nominal",0

column1: 363,"<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.

column2: • The prior art uses a single equi-spaced triplet arrangement of similar antenna elements to determine a function of elevation angle independent of the unknown ground reflection coefficient.
• The invention extends this idea to optimize angle measurements using the triplet itself, notably over selected sectors at low elevation angles.

column1: • The prior art is illustrated in FIG. 1, which shows a single equi-spaced triplet with two R.F. outputs A+C and B.

column2: • The outputs are functions of the antenna element pattern, transmitted power, range to the transmitter, mid-height of the triplet, ground reflection coefficient, elevation angle, spacing between triplet elements, and wavelength of the transmitted signal.
• The quotient of the outputs is independent of the antenna element pattern, transmitted power, range to the transmitter, mid-height of the triplet, and ground reflection coefficient.

column1: • The invention uses at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.

column2: • Each triplet has a different spacing and height above the ground plane, and radio receiver means to obtain information signals from each antenna.
• The information signals are combined vectorially to provide a first derived signal, and a second derived signal is derived from the centre antenna of each triplet.

column1: • The invention provides unambiguous angle measurement by dividing one derived signal by the other to provide a quotient signal for each triplet.

column2: • The quotient signal is a function of the elevation angle but not of the ground reflection coefficient.
• The array may operate in receive or transmit mode, with the transmitted signal from each antenna coded to enable angle measurement.

column1: • The invention is illustrated in FIG. 2, which shows three triplets with different spacings and heights above the ground plane.

column2: • FIG. 3 shows a practical embodiment of an antenna arranged as three triplets, with seven antenna elements deployed to operate on responses from secondary surveillance radar interrogations.
• The design aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements up to about 7 degrees, with measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-0.05 degrees.

column1: • The invention uses a circuit to measure the quotient signal, as shown in FIG. 5, which uses superheterodyne receivers and a divider to measure the decay time of a CR circuit.

column2: • The circuit provides a quotient signal that is independent of the absolute amplitude of the signals, and minimizes multi-path interference effects.
• The",0

column1: 364,"<summary>

• The invention relates to high intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamps, subminiature lamps, lamp assemblies, and a lamp system and method of making an efficient high intensity bulb and sleeve system having a liquid tight seal.

column2: • The prior art subminiature lamps have a glass envelope supported by a one or two piece base, with a low pitch thread for providing mechanical fixation to a socket.
• The prior art lamps have problems with adhesive breakdown, thermal cycling, and liquid invasion.

column1: • The invention uses a high temperature polymer which directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.

column2: • The polymer is a fluoroelastomer, such as VITON, which has excellent heat resistance, chemical resistance, and can withstand significant subminiature lamp temperature.
• The polymer can be pre-selected to resist permeation and volume increase, resist attack and property degradation caused by chemicals and fluids.

column1: • The seal supported subminiature lamp assembly has a polymeric seal support that forms a housing around both the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one piece conductive base, making a liquid tight seal.

column2: • The polymeric seal support has a bore that tightly forms a seal around the glass envelope, and extends downward into contact with the upward face of the abbreviated height one piece conductive base.
• The polymeric seal support can be molded or bored out to accommodate the glass envelope and the abbreviated height one piece conductive base.

column1: • The invention provides a longer seal length than conventional ""o"" ring seals, and eliminates the need for adhesive or cement.

column2: • The polymeric seal support allows for closer tolerance centering of the subminiature lamp glass envelope to the axis of the abbreviated height one piece conductive base.
• The invention provides a static radial seal with the straight sidewall of the subminiature lamp glass envelope surface.

column1: • The invention has advantages over conventional lamps, including the elimination of adhesive or cement, and the use of a single surface to make a seal.

column2: • The polymeric seal support seal is less prone to degradation than conventional ""o"" ring seals.
• The invention provides a liquid tight seal, minimizing the entry of deleterious fluids into the interior of the subminiature lamp assembly and its instrument.

365,"<summary>
• The invention relates to a method for configuring a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) precoder in a multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless system.

column2: • The method reduces the computational cost of determining the GDFE precoder components while achieving no capacity loss.
• The GDFE precoder is used in a base station to send simultaneous data streams to multiple user terminals.

• The method computes a filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas, and then computes a transmit filter matrix B, a feedforward filter matrix F, and an interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• The method does not require knowledge of the covariance matrix corresponding to ""Least Favorable Noise"" and can be used for channels with a rank less than or equal to the number of rows.
• The method can be used to improve the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including 4G cellular networks.
